that world, this one in this, <ls n="lan,103,7">103<sup>7</sup></ls>; that one

{%not to be named,%} so-and-so, <ab>N.</ab> or M.;

<L>126<pc>114-b<k1>अदिति<k2>अ/दिति

‘bind,’ but does not occur as such,
although there is a word {@द्íति,@} <ab>q. v.</ab>, of
quite different <ab>mg</ab> and origin.]

<L>502<pc>122-b<k1>अस्<k2>अस्<h>1
{@√1as@}¦ ({@ásti@} [<ls n="wg,636">636]</ls>; {@ā́sa@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} be, exist; be
present {%or%} on hand; take place, happen;
{@अस्ति, आसीत्,@} there is, there was, {%very frequent%}
{%at <ab>beg.</ab> of stories;%} <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} be, {%<ab>w.</ab> predicate possessive %} <lbinfo n="pos-sessive"/>
{%<ab>gen.</ab>, <ab>i. e.</ab>%} belong to; {@अस्ति मम,@}
I have; {%observe that <ab>Skt.</ab> has no verb for%}
‘have’; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%most frequent as simple copula;%}
{%further, <ab>w.</ab> ppls: <ab>e. g.</ab>%} {@prāpto@} ‘si, art thou
come, didst thou come, <ls n="lan,9,1">9<sup>1</sup></ls>; {@हन्तव्यो ऽस्मि,@}
{%occidendus sum,%} <ls n="lan,3,2">3<sup>2</sup></ls>; {@शेपानो ऽस्मि,@} I have
sworn, <ls n="lan,97,7">97<sup>7</sup></ls>; {%redundantly%} [<ls n="wg,303">303b<sup>4</sup></ls> end]: {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%}
{@तथा_अनुष्ठिते सति,@} it being thus performed, <lbinfo n="per-formed,"/>
 <ls n="lan,35,17">35<sup>17</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,37,13">37<sup>13</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,39,16, 22">39<sup>16, 22</sup></ls>; {@prahṛṣṭaḥ@}
[Page123-a+ 50]
{@सन्,@} being pleased, <ls n="lan,48,12">48<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%<ab>w.</ab> advs:%}
{@तूष्णीम् आसीत्,@} kept silent; {@एवम् अस्तु,@} so
be it; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@प्रादुस्,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>;%} <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} become,
<ls n="lan,96,19">96<sup>19</sup></ls>. [<ab>w.</ab> {@áस्-ति, स्-áन्ति,@} ‘is, are,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἔσ-τι</lang>,
‘ís, exists,’ <lang n="greek">εἰσί</lang>, Doric <lang n="greek">ἐντί, *ἅντι</lang>, ‘are,’
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%es-t, s-unt,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%is, *is-t, s-ind,%} ‘is, are,’
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%is;%} cognate are {%a-m, ar-t, are.%}]
<LEND>
<L>503<pc>123-a<k1>अस्<k2>अस्<h>2
{@√2as@}¦ ({@ásyati, -te; ā́sa; asiṣyáti; astá;@}
{@ásitum; asitvā́; -ásya@}). throw, cast,
shoot; throw aside. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@अस्í,@} ‘the brandished’  <lbinfo n="bran-dished’"/>
sword; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%ensis,%} ‘sword’; {%ālea,%}
{%*aslea,%} ‘die,’ like <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Würfel,%} ‘die,’ <ab>fr.</ab>
{%werfen,%} ‘throw.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ व्य्-अति,@} throw over, cross.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभि,@} throw (one's self) upon, direct
(one's attention) to, study. [for <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab>
<lang n="greek">προσέχειν</lang> without <lang n="greek">τὸν νοῦν</lang>.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} throw down; deposit; commit.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि-नि,@} throw down over, stretch
over.
<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} throw out; root out; destroy.
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} cast asunder; cast {%or%} throw
away; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} break in pieces, <ls n="lan,70,14">70<sup>14</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} cast {%or%} put together.

<L>698<pc>127-b<k1>इ<k2>इ
{@√i@}¦ ({@éti@} [<ls n="wg,612">612]</ls>; {@iyā́ya, īyús@} [<ls n="wg,783">783b<sup>2</sup></ls>]; {@eṣyáti;@}

to {%or%} towards; come; enter; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} move
on, <ls n="lan,86,12">86<sup>12</sup></ls>; pass; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} go to, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} attain (a
thing {%or%} condition); {@--ī́yase@} [<ls n="wg,1021">1021<sup>2</sup></ls>], goest
hither and thither, <ls n="lan,90,15">90<sup>15</sup></ls>; {@--īmahe@} [<ls n="wg,1021">1021<sup>2</sup></ls>],
({%like <ab>Ger.</ab>%} an-gehen) we approach with
prayers, beseech. [<ab>w.</ab> {@इ-म्áस्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἴ-μεν</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%i-mus,%} ‘we go’; <ab>Goth.</ab> {%i-ddja,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%eode,%}
‘went’; radically akin, perhaps, is <ab>AS.</ab>
{%gān%} (stem {%gā%} for {%*ga-i, ga-%} being the inseparable  <lbinfo n="in-separable"/>
prefix), <ab>Eng.</ab> {%go,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%gehen:%} see
also {@āyú, ā́yus.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अति,@} go beyond {%or%} past {%or%} over; overwhelm; <lbinfo n="over-whelm;"/>
 transcend; leave behind, get rid
of, <ls n="lan,68,9">68<sup>9</sup></ls>; escape.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अधि,@} come upon, notice; take notice,
<ls n="lan,87,18">87<sup>18</sup></ls>; {%--middle%} {@adhīté@} [<ls n="wg,612">612</ls> note], go over
for one's self, repeat, learn, read; {%<ab>ppl.</ab>%}
{@adhīta:@} {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>act.</ab> <ab>mg</ab>,%} learn-ed, <ls n="lan,18,6">18<sup>6</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>pass.</ab>%}
{%<ab>mg</ab>,%} learnt, <ls n="lan,21,15">21<sup>15</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} {@adhyāpáyati@}
[<ls n="wg,1042">1042e</ls>], cause to learn, teach.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप_अधि,@} {%in%} {@upādhyāya.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} go along {%or%} after; accompany;
{%<ab>ppl.</ab>%} {@अन्वित,@} accompanied by, endowed {%or%}
filled {%or%} connected with.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-अनु,@} {%the same.%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ अन्तर्,@} go within; retire, withdraw.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अप,@} go off; slink away.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभि,@} go unto; become embodied in.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अव,@} approach.
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} come near {%or%} unto {%or%} hither; {%<ab>w.</ab>%}
{%the <ab>adv.</ab>%} punar, go back.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभ्य्-आ,@} approach, go near.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप_आ,@} come unto.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-आ,@} come near to together; assemble. <lbinfo n="as-semble."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} go up, rise (of the sun).
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} go unto; fall to the lot of;

with.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-उप,@} come hither.
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} go into {%or%} in; {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@nyāya.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ परा,@} go away {%or%} forth; depart.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु-परा,@} go forth along (a path).
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि-परा,@} go away separately.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} circumambulate; walk round
(the fire).
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} go forward {%or%} onward, <ls n="lan,83,11">83<sup>11</sup></ls>;
{%<ab>esp.</ab>%} go forth out of this world, {%and so%} ({%like%}

in the other world ({%<ab>opp.</ab> of%} {@इह@}); {@प्रेत,@}
[Page128-b+ 50]
dead; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} come out, stick out, be prominent. <lbinfo n="prom-inent."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ प्रति,@} go against, withstand; go back
to; recognize, <ls n="lan,98,16">98<sup>16</sup></ls>; {@प्रतीत,@} recognized,
approved.

spread one's self over, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} pervade, <ls n="lan,72,2">72<sup>2</sup></ls>;

{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} free from….

<L>993<pc>138-a<k1>क<k2>क/<h>1
{@1ká@}¦ [<ls n="wg,504">504]</ls>, {%<ab>pron.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} {%interrogative.%} who,
what; {%used as <ab>subst.</ab>%} (<ls n="lan,7,6, 7">7<sup>6, 7</sup></ls>) {%or as <ab>adj.</ab>%}
(<ls n="lan,18,17">18<sup>17</sup></ls>); {@किम्@} {%<ab>w।</ab> <ab>इन्स्त्र्।</ab>: <ab>ए। ग्।</ab>%} {@किं युद्धेन,@}
what (is there) with fighting, what's the
use of fighting, <ls n="lan,45,14">45<sup>14</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,17,19">17<sup>19</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,24,9">24<sup>9</sup></ls>; {%so%} {@ko@}
{@‘र्थस्,@} <ls n="lan,17,18">17<sup>18</sup></ls>; {@kim@} {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>instr.</ab> and <ab>gen.</ab>: <ab>e. g.</ab>%}
{@नीरुजः किम् औषधैस्,@} what has a well
man (to do) with medicines, <ls n="lan,22,3">22<sup>3</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,32,21">32<sup>21</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,51,20">51<sup>20</sup></ls>; ka {%<ab>w.</ab> particles:%} {@को नाम,@} who indeed; <lbinfo n="in-deed;"/>
 {@को नु,@} who pray; {@को वा,@} who possibly, <lbinfo n="pos-sibly,"/>
 <ls n="lan,18,1">18<sup>1</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%indefinite, both <ab>adj.</ab> and <ab>subst.</ab>, chiefly%}
{%in negative clauses and <ab>w.</ab> the particles%} [{%see%}
[Page138-b+ 50]
<ls n="wg,507">507]</ls> {@ca, caná, cid, ápi; --2a.@} {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@mā́: mā́@}
{@क्áस्मै धातम् अभ्य् àमित्र्íणे नस्,@} deliver  <lbinfo n="de-liver"/>
us not over to any foe; <div n="2"/>{@—२ब्। क च,@}
some, any, {%<ab>adj.</ab> or <ab>subst.</ab>;%} {@किं च,@} anything; <lbinfo n="any-thing;"/>
 {%<ab>w.</ab> relative,%} {@याश् (च) काश् च,@} (and)
what soever, <ls n="lan,68,10">68<sup>10</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2c.@} {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@ca na@} {%and%}
{@चन: क च न,@} also {%or%} even not any;
{%<ab>esp.</ab> after a negative:%} {@na taṃ śaknuvanti@}
{@व्याहर्तुम् अपि, किं च न,@} can not even
speak to him, not even anything, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} can
not even speak anything to him, <ls n="lan,8,19">8<sup>19</sup></ls>; {%so%}
<ls n="lan,96,21">96<sup>21</sup></ls>; {%and so%} ({%the feeling for the negation in%}
{@cana@} {%in such collocations becoming lost%}), {@ka@}
{@cana@} {%means%} any, anything, {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@cana;@} {%<ab>w.</ab>%}
{%relative,%} soever; {@यत् किंचन,@} whatsoever,
<ls n="lan,9,16">9<sup>16</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2d.@} {%very often%} {@ka cid:@} any body {%or%}
thing; certain, <ls n="lan,18,11">18<sup>11</sup></ls>; {%often <ab>w.</ab> negative: <ab>e. g.</ab>%}
<ls n="lan,9,9">9<sup>9</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,24,11">24<sup>11</sup></ls> ({%twice with, twice without%}); {@kiṃcit@}
{@किंचिद्,@} each a little, <ls n="lan,27,9">27<sup>9</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> relative,%} {@ya@}
{@क चिद्,@} whosoever, whatsoever, any soever,
<ls n="lan,21,11">21<sup>11</sup></ls>; {@कानि कानि चिद्,@} any soever, <ls n="lan,82,15">82<sup>15</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—२ए। क अपि,@} something, somebody, <ls n="lan,17,11">17<sup>11</sup></ls>;
some, a {%or%} an, a certain, <ls n="lan,21,2">21<sup>2</sup></ls>; {@na ka api:@}
nothing, <ls n="lan,39,21">39<sup>21</sup></ls>; no, no one, <ls n="lan,20,10">20<sup>10</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—३।@} {%देरिव्स् ओड़्%} {@क,@} {%see%} <ls n="wg,505">505</ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%exclamatory,%} <lbinfo n="exclam-atory,"/>
{%at <ab>beg.</ab> of <ab>cpds</ab>: <ab>cf.</ab>, <ab>e. g.</ab>,%} {@का-पुरुष,@}
{@किम्-प्रभु, कु-दृष्टि, को-विद,@} {%and see%}
<ls n="wg,506">506,</ls> <ls n="wg,1121">1121e</ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} {%for%} {@kim@} {%as <ab>adv.</ab>, see%} {@kim.@}
[for the stem-forms {@क, कि, कु,@} see <ls n="wg,505">505</ls>:
<ab>cf.</ab> Ionic <lang n="greek">κο-</lang>, Attic <lang n="greek">πο-</lang>, in <lang n="greek">κό-θεν, κῶς</lang>, <ab>etc.</ab>,
‘whence, how’; <lang n="greek">τί-ς, τί</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%qui-s, qui-d,%}
<ab>AS.</ab> {%hwā, hwœ-t,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%who, wha-t;%} <ab>w.</ab> {@कतर्á,@} <lbinfo n="ka-tará,"/>
‘which of twain,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">κό-τερο-ς</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%uter,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%hwœ-ðer,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%whe-ther,%} ‘which of
twain’; <ab>w.</ab> {@ka@} as <ab>indef.</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τι-ς</lang> ‘any one.’]

<L>1169<pc>142-b<k1>कृ<k2>कृ<h>1
{@√1kṛ@}¦ ({%Vedic,%} {@kṛṇóti, kṛṇuté@} [<ls n="wg,715">715]</ls>; {%later,%}
{@karóti, kuruté@} [<ls n="wg,714">714]</ls>; {@cakā́ra, cakré;@} {%<ab>V.</ab>%}
{@ákar, ákṛta@} [<ls n="wg,831">831,</ls> <ls n="wg,834">834a</ls>]; {%later,%} {@ákārṣīt;@}
{@kariṣyáti; kṛtá; kártum; kṛtvā́; -kṛ́tya;@}
{@kriyáte; cíkīrṣati; kāráyati, -te@}). do,
make, {%in the various meanings and uses of%}
{%these words; thus,%}
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—1.@} perform, <ls n="lan,59,21">59<sup>21</sup></ls>; accomplish; cause;
effect; prepare, <ls n="lan,83,15">83<sup>15</sup></ls>; undertake, <ls n="lan,52,2">52<sup>2</sup></ls>;
commit, <ls n="lan,29,12">29<sup>12</sup></ls>; show: {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} honor, <ls n="lan,5,6">5<sup>6</sup></ls>; familiarity, <lbinfo n="fami-liarity,"/>
 <ls n="lan,9,17">9<sup>17</sup></ls>; compassion, <ls n="lan,21,19">21<sup>19</sup></ls>; love, <ls n="lan,42,18">42<sup>18</sup></ls>;
favor, <ls n="lan,52,21">52<sup>21</sup></ls>; contempt, <ls n="lan,54,16">54<sup>16</sup></ls>; attend to:
an affair, <ls n="lan,11,4">11<sup>4</sup></ls>; engage in: trade, <ls n="lan,46,11">46<sup>11</sup></ls>; a
quarrel, <ls n="lan,42,19">42<sup>19</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} do something (good {%or%}
[Page143-a+ 50]
bad) for a person ({%<ab>gen.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,3,2">3<sup>2</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,9,15">9<sup>15</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@}
make {%or%} procure for another, <ls n="lan,82,4">82<sup>4</sup></ls>; grant;
{%--middle:%} get for one's self; assume:
human voice, <ls n="lan,3,14">3<sup>14</sup></ls>; take on: form {%or%} shape,
<ls n="lan,48,3">48<sup>3</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,49,6">49<sup>6</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} execute; follow: advice,
<ls n="lan,40,7">40<sup>7</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} work over, prepare: food, <ls n="lan,68,3">68<sup>3</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—6.@} accomplish; be good for, <ls n="lan,18,5">18<sup>5</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—7.@}
make: a sound, <ls n="lan,26,17">26<sup>17</sup></ls>; utter: the syllable
om, <ls n="lan,60,8, 9">60<sup>8, 9</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—8.@} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} do {%in%} don, doff) put in
{%or%} on; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,81,1">81<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,43,6">43<sup>6</sup></ls>; set, <ls n="lan,105,14">105<sup>14</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab>%}
{%adverbs: see%} {@अग्रतस्, अमा, आविस्, तिरस्,@}
{@puras, bahis;@} <div n="2"/>{@—9.@} make a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%})
to be something ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,79,12">79<sup>12</sup></ls>; transform
into, <ls n="lan,40,13">40<sup>13</sup></ls> <ab>ff.</ab>; render, {%<ab>w.</ab> factitive predicate%}
{%<ab>acc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,18,8">18<sup>8</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> the predicate in composition%}
[<ls n="wg,1094">1094]</ls>: {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {@सज्जी-कृ,@} make ready, <ls n="lan,34,17">34<sup>17</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—१०।@} {%<ab>w।</ab> <ab>अद्व्।</ab> इन्%} {@-धा,@} divide in parts,
<ls n="lan,57,10">57<sup>10</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—11.@} do, go to work, proceed, <ls n="lan,37,8">37<sup>8</sup></ls>;
{%<ab>pass.</ab> <ab>impers.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,30,16">30<sup>16</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—12.@} do, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} sacred
work; {%with%} {@कर्म,@} <ls n="lan,97,2">97<sup>2</sup></ls>; {%without%} {@karma@}
({%like%} <lang n="greek">ῥέζειν θεῷ</lang> {%and%} facere), to sacrifice,
<ls n="lan,93,12">93<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%--see also%} {@kṛta.@}
<div n="1"/>{%--<ab>desid.</ab>%} desire to perform; {%<ab>ppl.</ab>%} [<ls n="wg,1037">1037]</ls>,
{@चिकीर्षित,@} that which is sought to be done,
intention.
<div n="1"/>{%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to do {%or%} make {%or%} be done
{%or%} made; see to it that a thing takes
place, <ls n="lan,16,1">16<sup>1</sup></ls>; {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} {@tena sa praṇāmaṃ@}
{@कारितस्,@} by him he was caused to make
obeisance, <ls n="lan,36,7">36<sup>7</sup></ls>; {%<ab>caus.</ab> <ab>equiv.</ab> to simple verb,%}
<ls n="lan,26,5">26<sup>5</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">αὐτο-κρά-τωρ</lang>, ‘self-actor, independent’; <lbinfo n="indepen-dent’;"/>
 <lang n="greek">Κρό-νος</lang>, an old harvest-god, ‘Perficus, <lbinfo n="‘Per-ficus,"/>
 the Completer, Ripener’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%cer-us,%}
‘creator’; <lang n="greek">κραίνω</lang>, ‘accomplish’; <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%creāre,%} ‘create’: {%see%} {@kratu:@} <ab>orig.</ab> root-form, 
 perhaps, {@स्कृ,@} <ls n="wg,1087">1087d</ls>.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अधि,@} put over; put in office.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अप,@} put off; injure, {%<ab>opp.</ab> of%} {@upakṛ.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ अरम्@} {%ओर्%} {@अलम्,@} {%see these words.%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} bring hither, <ls n="lan,74,10">74<sup>10</sup></ls>; prepare, fashion,
make.
<div n="p"/>{@+ व्य्-आ,@} separate, analyse.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} bring something to some one; do
a service, act as an auxiliary, {%<ab>opp.</ab> of%}
{@अपकृ।@} [<ab>w।</ab> थे उसे ओड़् {@उप,@} <ab>cf.</ab> that of {%sub%}
in {%subvenire,%} ‘aid.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} ({%<ab>poss.</ab>%} surround, deck, {%and so%})
make ready; adorn.
[Page143-b+ 50]
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} carry forward, accomplish;
effectuate, cause; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} set before;
put before one, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} make the subject of
discussion {%or%} treatment; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@बुद्धिम्,@} put
a plan before one's self, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} decide.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्रति,@} work against, counteract.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put together; conficere,
prepare; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} treat according to the
sacred usages, administer a sacrament
to, {%see%} {@saṃskāra;@} consecrate, <ls n="lan,106,3">106<sup>3</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@}
adorn.
<LEND>

<L>1235<pc>145-a<k1>क्रम्<k2>क्रम्
{@√क्रम्@}¦ ({@क्रा́मति@} [<ls n="wg,745">७४५द्</ls>], {@क्र्áमते; चक्रा́म,@} <lbinfo n="ca-krā́ma,"/>
{@चक्रम्é; áक्रमीत्; क्रमिष्य्áति,@}
{@-ते, क्रंस्य्áते; क्रान्त्á@} [<ls n="wg,955">९५५अ</ls>]; {@क्र्áमितुम्,@} <lbinfo n="krámi-tum,"/>
{@krā́ntum; kramitvā́, krāntvā́;@}
{@-krámya; kramyáte; kramáyati, krāmáyati@} <lbinfo n="krām-áyati"/>
[Page145-b+ 50]
[<ls n="wg,1042">1042c<sup>2</sup></ls> <ab>mid.</ab>]). step; go; go towards. <lbinfo n="to-wards."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ अति,@} step beyond; excel; overcome.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-अति,@} excel. [{@sam@} <ab>intens.</ab>, <ls n="wg,1077">1077b</ls>
end.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} step near to; come upon; attack;
overpower.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} go out; depart (of the vital spirit);
{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to disembark.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभ्य्-उद्,@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to step out.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} step unto; approach, <ls n="lan,3,10">3<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} go out.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परा,@} step forth; advance boldly;
{%and so,%} show one's strength {%or%} courage.
[hence {@पराक्रम,@} ‘valor’: <ab>cf.</ab> {@kram +@}
{@vi.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} go around, circumambulate.
<div n="p"/>{@+ पर,@} step forward; set out; start
from.
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} move away {%or%} on; proceed; attack
boldly; {%and so,%} show one's courage.
[hence {@विक्रम,@} ‘valor’: <ab>cf.</ab> {@kram +@}
{@parā.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} come together; approach; enter
(a zodiacal sign, said of the sun).

<L>1279<pc>146-b<k1>क्षि<k2>क्षि<h>1
{@√१क्षि,@}¦ {%with two meanings,%} ‘dwell,’ {%and%}
‘rule,’ {%attaching themselves to the stems%} {@kṣi@}
{%and%} {@kṣáya@} {%respectively; thus,%}
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—१। क्ष्é-ति,@} {%3d <ab>pl.</ab>%} {@kṣi-y-ánti:@} abide {%or%}
while {%or%} dwell, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} in quiet and safety,
<ls n="lan,79,18">79<sup>18</sup></ls>; inhabit. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@क्षित्í, १ क्ष्áय, क्ष्éत्र,@}
{@क्ष्éम १,@} ‘dwelling-place’; <lang n="greek">ἀμφι-κτί-ονες</lang>,
‘dwelling around,’ <lang n="greek">κτί-σι-ς</lang>, ‘settlement.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} rest on, be dependent on.
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—2. kṣáya-ti:@} pos-sess, be-sitzen; be
master of; rule, <ls n="lan,71,9">71<sup>9</sup></ls>. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@क्ष्éम २,@} ‘possession’; <lbinfo n="‘pos-session’;"/>
[Page147-a+ 50]
 <lang n="greek">κέ-κτη-μαι</lang>, ‘am master of,’ <lang n="greek">κτά</lang>-
<lang n="greek">ομαι</lang>, ‘get.’]
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> the collateral form {@kṣa:@} for connection  <lbinfo n="con-nection"/>
of 1 and 2, <ab>cf.</ab> the relation of <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%sedēre,%} ‘sit,’ and {%pos-sidēre,%} ‘be master of,’
and of <ab>Ger.</ab> {%sitzen,%} ‘sit,’ and {%be-sitzen,%} ‘be
master of.’]
<LEND>
<L>1280<pc>147-a<k1>क्षि<k2>क्षि<h>2
{@√२क्षि@}¦ ({@क्षिणा́ति,@} {%later%} {@kṣiṇóti; ákṣeṣṭa;@}
{@kṣitá, kṣīṇá; -kṣī́ya; kṣīyáte; kṣapáyati@} <lbinfo n="kṣapá-yati"/>
[<ls n="wg,1042">1042e</ls>]). destroy; make an end of;
exhaust; {%--<ab>pass.</ab>%} wane; {@क्षीण,@} ruined,
lost; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} weaken. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">φθίνω, *φθινυω</lang>,
‘perish, wane,’ <lang n="greek">φθί-μενος</lang>, ‘dead’: for <lang n="greek">φθ</lang>,
<ab>cf.</ab> {@क्षर्:@} <ab>w।</ab> थे सेचोन्दर्य् {@क्ष-न्,@} <ab>cf.</ab>
<lang n="greek">κτά-μενος</lang>, ‘slain,’ <lang n="greek">κτείνω, *κτεν-ϳω</lang>, ‘slay.’]
{@+ अप,@} {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} be afflicted, suffer loss.
<LEND>

<L>1284<pc>147-a<k1>क्षिप्<k2>क्षिप्
{@√kṣip@}¦ ({@kṣipáti, -te; cikṣépa, cikṣipé;@}

{@-kṣípya; kṣepáyati@}). dart; cast;
throw, {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to fly {%or%} burst, <ls n="lan,84,4">84<sup>4</sup></ls>.

fling, make flings at), deride, put to shame,
<ls n="lan,8,10">8<sup>10</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} draw towards one's self, call out
(a person to vindicate himself), <ls n="lan,55,6">55<sup>6</sup></ls>.

<div n="p"/>{@+ वि-नि,@} lay down separately {%or%} orderly.

<L>1320<pc>148-a<k1>ख्या<k2>ख्या

{%simple verb only in <ab>pass.</ab> and <ab>caus.</ab> --<ab>pass.</ab>%}
be well known; be talked of; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%}

<ab>mgs</ab>.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ व्य्-आ,@} show to discriminately, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} explain. <lbinfo n="ex-plain."/>

<L>1418<pc>152-a<k1>ग्रभ्<k2>ग्रभ्
{@√ग्रभ्,@}¦ {%in Rigveda; later,%} {@grah.@}
<div n="1"/>{%--from%} {@grabh: gṛbhṇā́ti, gṛbhṇīté;@}
{@jagrā́bha, jagṛbhé; ágrabhīt, ágrabhīṣṭa@}
[<ls n="wg,900">900]</ls>; {@gṛbhītá; gṛbhītvā́; -gṛ́bhya.@}
<div n="1"/>{%--from%} {@grah: gṛhṇā́ti; jagrā́ha, jagṛhé;@}
{@ágrahīt, ágrahīṣṭa@} [<ls n="wg,900">900]</ls>; {@grahīṣyáti, -te;@}
{@gṛhītá; gráhītum; gṛhītvā́; -gṛ́hya;@}
{@gṛhyáte; grāháyati, -te.@}
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—1.@} grasp; seize with the hand; hold;
take; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@ह्áस्तम्@} {%ओर्%} {@पाण्íम्,@} take the hand
(of the bride at the wedding), <ls n="lan,89,5">89<sup>5</sup></ls>; take
[Page152-b+ 49]
hold on ({%<ab>loc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,14,18">14<sup>18</sup></ls>; {@गृहीत केशेषु,@} seized
by the hair; {%used%} of a rabbit taking, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
leading with him a lion, <ls n="lan,33,4">33<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} take
possession of, take, <ls n="lan,46,22">46<sup>22</sup></ls>; get, <ls n="lan,44,5">44<sup>5</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@}
receive, accept, <ls n="lan,20,10">20<sup>10</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,56,1">56<sup>1</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} of fluids,
take in the ladle, <ls n="lan,94,1">94<sup>1</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} of names, take
upon the lips, mention, <ls n="lan,64,13">64<sup>13</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,103,19">103<sup>19</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@}
{%<ab>fig.</ab>, as in <ab>Eng.</ab>,%} grasp, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} perceive, know;
<div n="2"/>{@—7.@} get, learn; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to learn.
[see under {@garbha:@} connection <ab>w.</ab> <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%gripe,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%greifen,%} exceedingly doubtful.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} hold on both sides; {%and so%}
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} become master of; master, overcome,
surpass.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्रति,@} take hold of, <ls n="lan,59,23">59<sup>23</sup></ls>; accept.
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} hold asunder; separate; make
a division; {%and so%} <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} quarrel; fight.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} hold together, clasp.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप-सम्,@} clasp with the hands.
<LEND>

<L>1448<pc>153-a<k1>च<k2>च
{@च,@}¦ {%<ab>encl.</ab> <ab>conj.</ab>%} and, also, <lang n="greek">τε</lang>, que; <div n="2"/>{@—1a.@} {%is%}
{%found, <ab>esp.</ab> in the older literature, with both%}
{%parts to be connected%} ({%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} <ls n="lan,71,5, 7">71<sup>5, 7</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,97,7, 11">97<sup>7, 11</sup></ls>; {%so%}

<ls n="lan,22,5">22<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,37,15">37<sup>15</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,45,7">45<sup>7</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,77,12">77<sup>12</sup></ls>); {%sometimes after each,%}
(<ls n="lan,29,3, 4">29<sup>3, 4</sup></ls>); {%very rarely after the first of a scries%}
(<ls n="lan,26,6">26<sup>6</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,21,22">21<sup>22</sup></ls>); {%various irregular combinations%}
{%on page%} 67 {%passim; see also%} <ls n="lan,21,20">21<sup>20</sup></ls><ab>N.</ab>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%variously combined: <ab>w.</ab>%} {@eva@} ({%<ab>e. g.</ab>%}
<ls n="lan,13,21">13<sup>21</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,9,16">9<sup>16</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,11,9">11<sup>9</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,14,15">14<sup>15</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,5,9">5<sup>9</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,12,5">12<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,14,2, 8, 20">14<sup>2, 8, 20</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,15,16">15<sup>16</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,25,4">25<sup>4</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,30,14">30<sup>14</sup></ls>), {%and <ab>w.</ab>%} {@api@} ({%see examples under%}
{@अपि@});…{@च,…तथा,…च,@} both…, likewise…, <lbinfo n="like-wise…,"/>
 and, <ls n="lan,10,8, 9">10<sup>8, 9</sup></ls>; {@…च, …आ,@} both…,
and…, <ls n="lan,85,5">85<sup>5</sup></ls>; {@स च,@} {%often at <ab>beg.</ab> of clause%}
({%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} <ls n="lan,24,23">24<sup>23</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,34,18">34<sup>18</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,41,7">41<sup>7</sup></ls>); <div n="2"/>{@—३। अन्यच् च,@}
{@अपि च, किं च, तथा च,@} {%joining two proverbs %} <lbinfo n="prov-erbs"/>
{%of like drift,%} moreover, further, likewise; <lbinfo n="like-wise;"/>
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%otiose,%} <ls n="lan,6,9">6<sup>9</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} {%connecting things%}
{%contrasted:%} but, <ls n="lan,8,16">8<sup>16</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,17,20">17<sup>20</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,18,2, 3">18<sup>2, 3</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,19,2">19<sup>2</sup></ls>; and

though, <ls n="lan,26,12">26<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—7.@} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} and {%or%} an,
{%and Icelandic%} enda, ‘moreover,’ ‘if’) if--
{%see%} ced; <div n="2"/>{@—8.@} {%<ab>w.</ab> interrogatives, rendering%}
{%them <ab>indef.</ab>, see%} {@ka, kim.@}
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τε</lang>, ‘and’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%que,%} ‘and’; <ab>Goth.</ab> {%-h%}
and <ab>Ger.</ab> {%-ch%} in {%ni-h%} and {%no-ch,%} the exact
equivalents of <ab>Lat.</ab> {%ne-que,%} ‘and not, nor’:
for {@ca@} 8, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">-τε</lang> and <lang n="greek">-κα</lang> in <lang n="greek">πο-τε</lang> and Doric
<lang n="greek">πο-κα</lang>, ‘at any time’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%quis-que,%} ‘any,
each.’]

<L>1449<pc>153-b<k1>चक्र<k2>चक्र/

{%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%} [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">περι-τελ-λομένων ἐνιαυτῶν</lang>, ‘as

<L>1503<pc>155-b<k1>चि<k2>चि<h>1
{@√1ci@}¦ ({@cinóti, cinuté; cikyé@} [<ls n="wg,787">787]</ls>; {@ácet;@}
{@ceṣyáti, -te; citá; cétum; citvā́; -cítya;@}
{@cīyáte@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} arrange in order; pile up;
build; construct, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} the sacrificial altar;
{%active, if the priest builds for others; middle,%}
{%if the sacrificer builds for himself;%} <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
gather together, collect; get possession
of.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} heap up, collect.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} gather together, collect; accumulate. <lbinfo n="accumu-late."/>

<L>1612<pc>158-b<k1>जि<k2>जि<h>1

<L>1708<pc>162-a<k1>तन्<k2>तन्<h>1
{@√1tan@}¦ ({@tanóti, tanuté; tatā́na, tené@}
[<ls n="wg,794">794e</ls>]; {@átānīt; taṃsyáte; tatá; tántum;@}
{@tatvā́; -tátya; tāyáte@} [<ls n="wg,772">772]</ls>). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@}
stretch, {%<ab>trans.</ab> and <ab>intrans.</ab>;%} extend, reach;
spread over; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} continue, endure, <ls n="lan,79,13">79<sup>13</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} stretch (a weft {%or%} a line); continue
(the line of a family); <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%metaphorically,%}
of sacrifice and supplication (which are
compared with a weft), perform, make.
[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τάνυμαι</lang>, ‘stretch’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%tenēre,%} ‘hold,’
{%tendere,%} ‘stretch’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%ϸenian,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%dehnen,%}
‘stretch’: see also {@tanu.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} spread over; overspread ({%<ab>esp.</ab>%} with
light), beshine; stretch (a bow).
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} stretch around; surround; envelope. <lbinfo n="en-velope."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} stretch out; spread out, cover;
{@वितत,@} stretched, hung, dependent, <ls n="lan,92,11">92<sup>11</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} hold together, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>;%} bind together; <lbinfo n="to-gether;"/>
 make continuous; {@संतत,@} ({%just%}
{%like <ab>Lat.</ab>%} con-tinens) uninterrupted.
<LEND>
<L>1709<pc>162-a<k1>तन्<k2>तन्<h>2
{@√2tan@}¦ ({@tányati@}). resound. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τόνος</lang>,
‘tone’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%tonare,%} ‘thunder’; <ab>AS.</ab> noun

horizontal; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%as <ab>subst.</ab> <ab>m.</ab> <ab>n.</ab>%} beast (going
horizontally, as opposed to man, who walks
upright--{@ऊर्ध्व@}); <div n="2"/>{@—३।@} {%<ab>अच्च्।</ab> <ab>स्।</ab> <ab>न्।</ab>%} {@तिर्यक्,@}
{%as <ab>adv.</ab>%} across. [{@तिरस्@} ओर् {@तिर्,@} <ab>w.</ab> {@अञ्च्,@} <ls n="wg,409">409d</ls>:
{@तिर्,@} like {@तिरस्,@} is akin <ab>w.</ab> {@√tṛ.@}]

<L>1915<pc>168-b<k1>दा<k2>दा<h>1

<L>2138<pc>175-a<k1>धर्म<k2>ध/र्म
{@ध्áर्म,@}¦ {%<ab>m.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} custom, <ls n="lan,98,16">98<sup>16</sup></ls>; usage,
<ls n="lan,99,11">99<sup>11</sup></ls>; right; duty, <ls n="lan,28,6">28<sup>6</sup></ls>; virtue, <ls n="lan,21,7">21<sup>7</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,10,13">10<sup>13</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,15,17">15<sup>17</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,29,1">29<sup>1</sup></ls>; (virtue, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) good works, <ls n="lan,29,5">29<sup>5</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,63,11">63<sup>11</sup></ls>; correct course of conduct, <ls n="lan,11,3">11<sup>3</sup></ls>;
{@धर्मे,@} in a question of right, <ls n="lan,21,14">21<sup>14</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—१अ। धर्मेण,@} {%<ab>adv.</ab>:%} as was right, <ls n="lan,14,17">14<sup>17</sup></ls>;
dutifully, <ls n="lan,16,5">16<sup>5</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} law; prescription,
rule; the law (as a system), <ls n="lan,28,5">28<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,58,16, 19">58<sup>16, 19</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%personified,%} Virtue, <ls n="lan,67,17">67<sup>17</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,48,4">48<sup>4</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[a post-Vedic word, taking the place of
<ab>V.</ab> {@dhárman: dharma@} is <ab>fr.</ab> {@√dhṛ@} (<ls n="wg,1166">1166b</ls>),
perhaps in <ab>mg</ab> 6, and thus designating
ancient custom or right as ‘that which
holds its own, which persists {%or%} endures’;
but it may come <ab>fr.</ab> {@√dhṛ@} in <ab>mg</ab> 1, so that
{@dharma@} is ‘that which is established {%or%}
settled’; in the latter case, <ab>cf.</ab>, for the
<ab>mg</ab>, <lang n="greek">θέμις</lang>, ‘that which is established as
custom or law,’ <ab>w.</ab> <lang n="greek">τίθημι</lang>, ‘set, establish,’
and <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Ge-setz,%} ‘law,’ <ab>w.</ab> {%setzen,%} ‘set.’]

<L>2149<pc>175-b<k1>धा<k2>धा<h>1
{@√१धा@}¦ ({@द्áधाति, धत्त्é@} [<ls n="wg,668">६६८]</ls>; {@दधú,@}
{@दध्é; áधात्, áधित@} [<ls n="wg,884">८८४]</ls>; {@धास्य्áति,@}
{@-ते;@} {%<ab>व्।</ab>%} {@-धित,@} {%later%} {@hitá@} [<ls n="wg,954">954c</ls>]; {@dhā́tum;@}
{@धित्वा́; -धा́य; धीय्áते; द्íधिषति,@}
{@dhítsati; dhāpáyati@} [<ls n="wg,1042">1042d</ls>]).
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put, <ls n="lan,86,10">86<sup>10</sup></ls>; set; lay, <ls n="lan,39,14">39<sup>14</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} put
in a place, bring to, {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@तत्र,@} <ls n="lan,85,19">85<sup>19</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%}
<ls n="lan,89,8">89<sup>8</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,95,5">95<sup>5</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>dat.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,83,1">83<sup>1</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} put upon, direct  <lbinfo n="di-rect"/>
towards; {@धर्मे धा मनस्,@} set the
heart on virtue, <ls n="lan,66,7">66<sup>7</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} put something
for a person {%(<ab>dat.</ab>), <ab>i. e.</ab>%} bestow upon him,
grant him, <ls n="lan,84,1">84<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ab>RV.</ab> x. <ls n="wg,125">125.</ls> 2; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} put in
a position, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} appoint, constitute, {%<ab>w.</ab> double%}
{%<ab>acc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,88,12">88<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} make, cause, produce;
<div n="2"/>{@—7.@} hold, keep, <ls n="lan,86,6, 9">86<sup>6, 9</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—8.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} take to
one's self, receive, obtain, win; {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} {@garbhaṃ @} <lbinfo n="gar-bhaṃ"/>
{@धा,@} conceive fruit in the womb,
<ls n="lan,92,12">92<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—9.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} assume, <ls n="lan,19,7">19<sup>7</sup></ls>; maintain;
<div n="2"/>{@—१०। हित,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>;%} <div n="2"/>{@—11.@} {%<ab>desid.</ab> <ab>act.</ab>%} desire
to grant; {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} desire to win.
<div n="1"/>[The original meaning of the root is
‘put’; but, from the proethnic period, a
secondary development in the line (‘set,’
‘establish,’ and so) ‘make,’ ‘do,’ is clear.
The secondary <ab>mg</ab> has even won the more
prominent place in Germanic and Slavic.
<div n="1"/>For the primary <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">τίθημι</lang>, ‘put’
(the parallelism of its <ab>mgs</ab> is remarkable
--<lang n="greek">θέσαν, λίθον</lang>, ‘they set a stone’; <lang n="greek">θέσθαι</lang>
<lang n="greek">υἱόν</lang>, ‘conceive a son,’ <ab>etc.</ab>, <ab>etc.</ab>); <ab>Lat.</ab> {%abde-re,%} <lbinfo n="ab-de-re,"/>
‘put off {%or%} away,’ and {%con-de-re,%} ‘put
together, construct, establish’; <ab>Eng.</ab> do,
[Page176-a+ 50]
‘put,’ in the contract forms {%doff, don, dup;%}
<ab>Ger.</ab> {%weg-thun,%} ‘do away {%or%} put away.’
<div n="1"/>For the secondary <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">θεῖναί τινα</lang>
<lang n="greek">βασιλέα</lang>, ‘make one a king’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%dōn hine%}
{%tō cyninge,%} ‘make him a king’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%fīo,%}
‘am made’; <ab>Eng.</ab> {%do, deed;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%thun,%}
‘do’; Slavic {%dĕ-lo,%} ‘deed’: observe that
{%fi-eri,%} ‘become,’ is to {%fă-c-ere,%} ‘make,’ as
{%ī-re (√ja),%} ‘go,’ is to {%jă-c-ere,%} ‘make to
go, throw.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अन्तर्,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put into the interior of
a thing; {%and so%} <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} hide, conceal.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अपि,@} put close upon; cover (a jar with
its lid); {@áपिहित,@} closed up. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἐπιτίθημι</lang>,
‘put upon.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभि,@} put on; put a name upon, designate; <lbinfo n="desig-nate;"/>
 address; speak to, <ls n="lan,43,10">43<sup>10</sup></ls>; say, <ls n="lan,42,20">42<sup>20</sup></ls>;
{@अभिहितम्,@} (it was) said, <ls n="lan,38,13">38<sup>13</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अव,@} put down in; {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} duck ({%<ab>trans.</ab>%})
into the water; {@áवहित,@} fallen into the
water; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to be laid in.
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} put {%or%} lay {%or%} set in {%or%} on, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>,%}
<ls n="lan,77,1">77<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,79,12">79<sup>12</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,88,15">88<sup>15</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,90,5">90<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,102,21">102<sup>21</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} put on
(wood on the fire), <ls n="lan,82,15">82<sup>15</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} set for
one's self on (the hearth a sacred fire),
<ls n="lan,95,12">95<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} put on one's self, take on,
<ls n="lan,74,6">74<sup>6</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} take, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} take away, <ls n="lan,87,10">87<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ व्य्-आ,@} {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} be separated; be uncomfortable  <lbinfo n="uncom-fortable"/>
{%or%} sick.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-आ,@} put upon; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@मनस्,@} concentrate  <lbinfo n="concen-trate"/>
the mind upon one thing; {@समाहित,@}
intent, eager, <ls n="lan,1,13">1<sup>13</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप-सम्-आ,@} set together (wood) unto
(an already burning fire), put (fuel) on,
<ls n="lan,100,16">100<sup>16</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,105,10">105<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} put on ({%<ab>esp.</ab>%} a brick {%or%} stone
on the sacred fire-altar {%or%} enclosure),
<ls n="lan,96,8">96<sup>8</sup></ls> <ab>ff.</ab>
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} lay down, <ls n="lan,87,8">87<sup>8</sup></ls>; set down (sacred
fire), <ls n="lan,85,6">85<sup>6</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@क्रियाम्,@} put labor upon
({%<ab>loc.</ab>%}), take pains with, <ls n="lan,19,14">19<sup>14</sup></ls>; {@निहित,@} put
down, lying low, <ls n="lan,70,19">70<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सं-नि,@} lay down together; put together; <lbinfo n="to-gether;"/>
 {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} be near together; {@संनिहित,@} <lbinfo n="saṃni-hita,"/>
near, impending, <ls n="lan,25,15">25<sup>15</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} put around; {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} put (part of a
sacrificial fence) around (an altar), <ls n="lan,105,13">105<sup>13</sup></ls>;
put around one's self, put on, (garments)
<ls n="lan,103,19">103<sup>19</sup></ls>, (shoes) <ls n="lan,45,11">45<sup>11</sup></ls>; clothe.
<div n="p"/>{@+ पुरस्,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%}
[Page176-b+ 50]
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} set forward. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@pradhana, pradhāna.@} <lbinfo n="pra-dhāna."/>
]
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} part, mete out, distribute;
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} spread abroad, <ab>RV.</ab> x. <ls n="wg,125">125.</ls> 3; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} ({%like%}
{%<ab>Lat.</ab>%} dis-pōnere) arrange, determine; prescribe, <lbinfo n="pre-scribe,"/>
 <ls n="lan,59,7">59<sup>7</sup></ls>; {@विहित,@} ordained, <ls n="lan,14,4">14<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} lay
out, make, build; prepare, <ls n="lan,54,18">54<sup>18</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} accomplish, <lbinfo n="ac-complish,"/>

{%Vedic only,%} <ls n="lan,70,15, 18">70<sup>15, 18</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,71,7, 9">71<sup>7, 9</sup></ls>, <ab>etc.</ab>; {@न्á,@} ‘like,’
{%does not coalesce metrically in Veda <ab>w.</ab> following %} <lbinfo n="fol-lowing"/>
{%initial vowel.%}

<L>2261<pc>180-b<k1>नश्<k2>नश्<h>1
{@√1naś@}¦ ({@náśyati; nanā́śa, neśús; ánaśat;@}
{@naṅkṣyáti@} [<ls n="wg,936">936]</ls>; {@naṣṭá; nāśáyati@}). be
missing; get lost; vanish; perish, be
ruined. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">νεκ-ρός</lang>, ‘dead’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%nex,%}
‘death’; {%nocēre,%} ‘harm.’]

<L>2370<pc>184-a<k1>नुद्<k2>नुद्

<L>2427<pc>185-b<k1>पत्<k2>पत्

<L>2524<pc>189-a<k1>पा<k2>पा<h>1
{@√1pā@}¦ ({@píbati, -te@} [<ls n="wg,671">671,</ls> <ls n="wg,749">749]</ls>; {@papaú, papé;@}
{@ápāt; pāsyáti, -te; pītá@} [<ls n="wg,954">954c</ls>]; {@pā́tum;@}
{@pītvā́; -pā́ya, -pī́ya@}). drink. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">πέ</lang>-
<lang n="greek">πω-κα</lang>, ‘have drunk’; <lang n="greek">Πῖ-σα</lang>, ‘The Burn,
The Fountain’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%pō-tus,%} ‘drunk’;
{%bibo, *pi-b-o,%} ‘drink.’]

<L>2662<pc>193-a<k1>पृ<k2>पृ<h>1
{@√1pṛ@}¦ ({@pṛṇā́ti; pū́ryate; pūrṇá@} [<ls n="wg,957">957b</ls>];
{%<ab>pass.</ab>%} {@pūryáte; pūráyati, -te;@} <ab>etc.</ab>). fill;

<L>2700<pc>194-a<k1>प्रछ्<k2>प्रछ्
{@√prach@}¦ ({@pṛccháti, -te; papráccha@} [<ls n="wg,794">794c</ls>];
{@áprākṣīt; prakṣyáti; pṛṣṭá; práṣṭum;@}
{@pṛṣṭvā́; -pṛ́cchya@}). ask; ask after, inquire  <lbinfo n="in-quire"/>

{%forskōt, *forh-skōt,%} ‘asks for,’ <ab>Ger.</ab> {%forscht,%}
‘inquires into.’]

<L>2810<pc>197-b<k1>प्राञ्च्<k2>प्रा/ञ्च्

 {%<ab>w.</ab> verb of motion,%} onward, <ls n="lan,86,9">86<sup>9</sup></ls>;

formerly, <ls n="lan,20,20">20<sup>20</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,51,7">51<sup>7</sup></ls>; (in order) before, {%<ab>w.</ab>%}

<L>2846<pc>198-b<k1>प्लु<k2>प्लु
{@√plu@}¦ ({@plávate, -ti; puplā́va, pupluvé;@}
{@áप्लोष्ट; प्लोष्य्áति, -ते; प्लुत्á; -प्ल्úत्य,@}
{@-plū́ya@}). float through water {%or%} air:
[Page199-a+ 49]
<div n="2"/>{@—1.@} swim; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} bathe; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} sail; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@}
hover; fly; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} fly off; hasten away;
<div n="2"/>{@—६।@} स्प्रिन्ग्; {@--प्लुत,@} floating, {%and so%} ({%see%}
<ls n="wg,78">Whitney 78</ls>), protracted, of a vowel.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">πλέω, *πλεϝω</lang>, ‘float, sail’; <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%pluere,%} ‘rain’: for <ab>mg</ab> of {%pluere,%} <ab>cf.</ab> the
<ab>Eng.</ab> <ab>intrans.</ab> {%float,%} ‘swim,’ <ab>w.</ab> <ab>trans.</ab> {%float,%}
‘cover with water,’ and the <ab>intrans.</ab> {%bathe%}
<ab>w.</ab> <ab>trans.</ab> {%bathe:%}
<div n="1"/>closely connected <ab>w.</ab> {@√plu@} is the extended  <lbinfo n="ex-tended"/>
form {@plud@} as seen in Lithuanian
{%plud-iti,%} ‘swim, float’: <ab>w.</ab> this, <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>AS.</ab>
{%fleōt-an,%} ‘swim {%or%} float about,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> verb
{%fleet,%} ‘float, sail, hasten,’ <ab>Ger.</ab> {%fliessen,%}
sometimes ‘swim,’ but usually ‘flow’;
further, <ab>AS.</ab> {%fleōt,%} ‘raft, ship, fleet,’ <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%fleet,%} ‘ships’; also <ab>AS.</ab> {%flota,%} ‘ship,’ <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%float,%} ‘a thing that swims on the surface
of a fluid, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} a raft’ (verb {%float%} is a
<ab>denom.</ab> of this), <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Floss,%} ‘raft’; finally
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%fleet,%} ‘streamlet {%or%} bay,’ whence {%The%}
{%Fleet,%} as name of a small affluent of the
Thames at London and of a famous prison
thereon, and {%Fleet Street,%} which crossed
The Fleet.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} bathe, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-आ,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} bathe, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>;%} <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
bathe, {%<ab>trans.</ab>;%} inundate; suffuse, <ls n="lan,10,19">10<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} spring up.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} hover unto.
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} float asunder; drift in different
directions; be dispersed; be lost; be
ruined {%or%} dishonored.
<LEND>
<L>2847<pc>199-a<k1>फल्<k2>फल्
{@√phal@}¦ ({@phálati; paphā́la; phalitá;@}
{@phullá@} [<ls n="wg,958">958]</ls>). burst, split, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>%} [<ab>prob.</ab>
for {@*स्पल्,@} of which {@√sphaṭ@} (<ab>i. e.</ab> {@*sphalt@}),

<L>2907<pc>201-a<k1>बुध्<k2>बुध्
{@√बुध्@}¦ ({@ब्óधति, -ते; ब्úध्यते; बुब्óध,@}
{@बुबुध्é; áबुद्ध@} [<ls n="wg,160">१६०]</ls>; {@भोत्स्य्áति,@}
[Page201-b+ 50]
{@-te; buddhá; bóddhum; buddhvā́;@}
{@-búdhya@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} be awake; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} come to
consciousness; {%hence%} <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} notice; give
heed to, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>gen.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,76,12">76<sup>12</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} notice, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
perceive; {%and so,%} become acquainted with;
understand; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} {%rarely,%} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} remember  <lbinfo n="re-member"/>
a person, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) presént a person
with a thing {%(<ab>instr.</ab>); --<ab>caus.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—6a.@} cause
to notice {%or%} understand; <div n="2"/>{@—6b.@} teach;
announce to.
<div n="1"/>[for {@*भुध्,@} <ab>orig.</ab> ‘be awake,’ <ab>cf.</ab>
Church Slavonic {%bŭd-ĕti,%} ‘be awake’: the
cognate words of the related languages
agree closely in form, but show considerable  <lbinfo n="consider-able"/>
diversity of <ab>mgs</ab>: <ab>mg</ab> 4 mediates
the transition to the idea of the Greek
<lang n="greek">√πυθ, *φυθ</lang>, in <lang n="greek">πυθέσθαι</lang>, ‘find out’: <ab>mgs</ab> 5
and 6 form the bridge to the principal
Germanic <ab>mgs</ab>, ‘offer’ and ‘command’:
<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Goth.</ab> {%ana-biud-an,%} (<ab>prob.</ab> ‘give notice
to,’ and so) ‘command,’ <ab>AS.</ab> {%beōd-an,%}
‘announce, offer, command,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%bid,%}
‘announce, offer in words, offer {%in general,%}
{%<ab>esp.</ab>%} at an auction, declare, proclaim, command, <lbinfo n="com-mand,"/>
 invite,’ <ab>Ger.</ab> {%biet-en,%} ‘offer’; (from
an entirely different root is <ab>Eng.</ab> {%bid,%} <ab>AS.</ab>
{%biddan,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%bitten,%} ‘pray,’ as in {%bid beads,%}
‘pray prayers’;) <ab>cf.</ab> also <ab>Eng.</ab> noun {%bode,%}
‘announcement,’ whence <ab>denom.</ab> verb
{%bode,%} ‘foretell’: for <ab>mg</ab> 5, observe the
analogy of <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Jemand bedenken,%} ‘remember  <lbinfo n="‘re-member"/>
{%or%} take notice of a person {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} in
one's will, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} make a bequest to.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} attend to, <ls n="lan,58,1">58<sup>1</sup></ls>; understand, know,
<ls n="lan,7,9">7<sup>9</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} come forth (from sleep) to consciousness; <lbinfo n="con-sciousness;"/>
 awake, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}

<L>2935<pc>203-a<k1>ब्रू<k2>ब्रू
{@√brū@}¦ ({@brávīti@} [<ls n="wg,632">632]</ls>, {@brūté:@} {%the second%}
{%clause of%} <ls n="wg,632">632</ls> {%should read%} “before the
initial {%consonant%} of an ending”). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} {%<ab>act.</ab>%}
say; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>dat.</ab> of person and <ab>acc.</ab> of thing,%}
<ls n="lan,10,21">10<sup>21</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,96,14">96<sup>14</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> of person and either%}
{%oratio recta%} (<ls n="lan,12,5">12<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,60,7, 23">60<sup>7, 23</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,98,11">98<sup>11</sup></ls>) {%or else <ab>acc.</ab>%}
{%of thing%} (<ls n="lan,95,13">95<sup>13</sup></ls>); speak to, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> of person,%}
<ls n="lan,3,14">3<sup>14</sup></ls>; speak of, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> of person,%} <ls n="lan,11,18">11<sup>18</sup></ls>;
say, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} announce, tell; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@वचस्,@} <lang n="greek">ἔπος</lang>
<lang n="greek">εἰπεῖν</lang>, <ls n="lan,10,18">10<sup>18</sup></ls>; {%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@पुनर्,@} answer, <ls n="lan,8,3">8<sup>3</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
{%middle,%} {@brūté@} ({%used <ab>esp.</ab> to introduce oratio%}
{%recta and without designation of the person%}
{%addressed%}), says, inquit, <ls n="lan,20,18">20<sup>18</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,28,1">28<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,30,5, 10, 12">30<sup>5, 10, 12</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,35,18">35<sup>18</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अप,@} remove (the thought {%or%} recollection  <lbinfo n="recollec-tion"/>
of a thing {%or%} person, {%<ab>acc.</ab>,%} from a
person, {%<ab>abl.</ab>%}) by speaking, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} try to console  <lbinfo n="con-sole"/>
a person ({%<ab>abl.</ab>%}) for the loss of a thing
{%or%} person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,92,14">92<sup>14</sup></ls>. [this locution is
apparently like the <ab>Eng.</ab> <ab>colloq.</ab> phrase
“I'll {%talk%} it (his opinion) {%out of%} him.”]

<L>2950<pc>203-b<k1>भज्<k2>भज्
{@√bhaj@}¦ ({@bhájati, -te; babhā́ja, bhejé@} [<ls n="wg,794">794e</ls>];

{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} {@bhājáyati@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} deal out; apportion; <lbinfo n="appor-tion;"/>
 divide; {%then%} ({%as <ab>Eng.</ab>%} share {%means%}

have {%or%} take part in; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} give one's self
up to; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} (choose as one's part, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) declare  <lbinfo n="de-clare"/>

love, <ls n="lan,9,20">9<sup>20</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to have a share,
{%w <ab>acc.</ab> of person and <ab>gen.</ab> of thing,%} <ls n="lan,83,8">83<sup>8</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">φαγ-εῖν</lang>, ‘get one's portion, eat,’
<ab>w.</ab> a specialization of <ab>mg</ab> like those seen
in <ab>Eng.</ab> {%partake%} and {%take%} as used with the
implied object {%food%} or {%drink,%} in {@भक्त,@}
‘thing divided, portion, food,’ and in
{@bhakṣ:@} akin are the names of the two
food-trees yielding eatable nuts (acorns,
buck-mast), <lang n="greek">φᾱγός, φηγός</lang>, ‘oak,’ <ab>Lat.</ab> {%fāgus,%}
‘beech,’ <ab>AS.</ab> {%bōc,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%buck-,%} ‘beech-,’ in
{%buck-mast,%} ‘beech-nuts,’ and {%buck-wheat%} (so
called from the likeness of the kernels to
beech-nuts), <ab>AS.</ab> {%bēce,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%beech:%} with {%bōc,%}
‘beech,’ is <ab>ident.</ab> {%bōc,%} ‘book,’ <ab>orig.</ab> ‘runes
scratched on branches of a fruit-bearing
tree,’ see Tacitus, Germania, x.; such a
branch was called by a name which became
in Old High <ab>Ger.</ab> {%puah-stap%} or {%buoh-stab,%}
and meant <ab>orig.</ab> ‘beech-staff’; but the
word came to be used for the significant
thing on the branch, ‘the rune {%or%} letter,’
AS {%bōc-stæf,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Buch-stabe.%}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} {%<ab>act.</ab>, sometimes <ab>mid.</ab>,%} deal out to, give
a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) a share in a thing ({%<ab>loc.</ab>%}).

<L>3014<pc>206-b<k1>भुज्<k2>भुज्<h>1
{@√1bhuj@}¦ ({@bhujáti; bhugná; -bhújya@}).
bend; turn; make crooked. [so far as
the meaning goes, the following words
may well be taken as cognate: <lang n="greek">φυγ-εῖν</lang>,
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%fug-ere,%} ‘turn about, flee’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%būg-an,%}
‘bend, turn about’ (<ab>intrans.</ab>), sometimes
also ‘flee,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> verb {%bow%} (as in {%bow down%}),
‘bend’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%boga,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%bow,%} ‘arcus,’ {%el-bow,%}
{%rain-bow;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%bieg-sam,%} ‘pliable,’ Old <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%būh-sum,%} ‘pliable, yielding,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%buxom,%}
‘lithe, lively, vigorous’: but the Germanic  <lbinfo n="Ger-manic"/>
{%g%} raises phonetic difficulties which
are not yet satisfactorily cleared up.]

<L>3015<pc>206-b<k1>भुज्<k2>भुज्<h>2
{@√२भुज्@}¦ ({@भुन्áक्ति, भुङ्क्त्é; बुभ्óज,@}
{@bubhujé; ábhujat; bhokṣyáti, -te;@}
{@bhuktá; bhóktum; bhuktvā́@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} enjoy; <lbinfo n="en-joy;"/>
 {%in Veda,%} (have use with, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) have
the use of a thing ({%and so <ab>w.</ab> <ab>instr.</ab>%});
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%in later <ab>Skt.</ab>%} ({%like <ab>Ger.</ab>%} geniessen, {%<ab>cf.</ab>%}
{%also%} {@bhoga@} {%and%} {@bhojana@}), enjoy {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} food,
[Page207-a+ 50]
{%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab>;%} <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%without object,%} take one's
meal; {%then%} <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} enjoy (things that are
not food), {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab>,%} <ls n="lan,10,9">10<sup>9</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} reap the fruit
(of sin) at the hands of a person ({%<ab>gen.</ab>%}),
<ls n="lan,79,17">79<sup>17</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to take food, feed.
[if for {@*bhruj@} (but this is doubtful--see
{@√bhañj@}), then <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%frui, *frugvi,%} ‘have
use with’ (a thing, hence <ab>instr.</ab>-<ab>abl.</ab>),
‘enjoy’; {%frug-es,%} ‘fruit’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%brūcan,%}
‘enjoy’ (food or drink), ‘use,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%brook,%}
<ab>orig.</ab> ‘use,’ now ‘put up with.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} reap the fruit (of good {%or%} evil
deeds).
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} enjoy, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} (enjoy food, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%})
eat; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} reap the fruit (of good {%or%} evil
deeds).
<LEND>

<L>3046<pc>208-b<k1>भृ<k2>भृ
{@√bhṛ@}¦ ({@bíbharti@} [<ls n="wg,645">645]</ls>; {@bhárati, -te;@} {%<ab>V.</ab>%}
{@jabhā́ra, jabhré@} [<ls n="wg,789">789b</ls>]; {%later,%} {@babhā́ra;@}
{@ábhārṣīt; bhariṣyáti; bhṛtá; bhártum;@}
{@-bhṛ́tya@}). bear ({%<ab>cf.</ab> the various senses of%}
bear {%in <ab>Eng.</ab>%}): {%thus,%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} hold, {%and so%} possess; <lbinfo n="pos-sess;"/>
 <div n="2"/>{@—२।@} बेअर् (इन् थे wओम्ब्); {@अभरत्,@}
she bare, <ls n="lan,85,15">85<sup>15</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} endure; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} carry,
convey; <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} (bear, {%<ab>i. e.</ab> as in Latimer%})
win; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} bring (as an offering, {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} of-fer),

(see {@√śaṃs@}), then ‘magic spell,’
whence <ab>Eng.</ab> {%charm.%}]

<L>3213<pc>215-a<k1>मा<k2>मा<h>1
{@√1mā@}¦ ({@mímīte@} [<ls n="wg,660">660</ls>-3]; {@mamaú, mamé;@}
{@ámāsta; mitá@} [<ls n="wg,954">954c</ls>]; {@mā́tum; mitvā́;@}
{@-mā́ya@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} measure; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} measure
with, compare; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} mete out; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} arrange, <lbinfo n="ar-range,"/>
 form; build; make, <ls n="lan,72,2">72<sup>2</sup></ls>. [for 1,
<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">μέ-τρον</lang>, ‘measure’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%ni-mi-us,%} ‘not
to be measured, excessive’; for 4, <ab>cf.</ab>
<lang n="greek">μά-ρη</lang> and <ab>Lat.</ab> {%mă-nu-s,%} ‘former, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} hand’;
<lang n="greek">εὐ-μαρής</lang>, ‘handy, easy’: see also the collateral  <lbinfo n="col-lateral"/>
form {@√१मि,@} ‘build, set up,’ and
under mātṛ́ and mā́<ab>s.</ab>]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} (form after, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) re-create in
imagination, conceive.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} measure with, compare.
<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} fashion {%or%} make out of ({%<ab>abl.</ab>%}); construct. <lbinfo n="con-struct."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ वि-निस्,@} lay out (garden).
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} measure around, limit.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} measure.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्रति,@} make (so as to be a match)
against, {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@pratimā.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} measure out; {%then%} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} measure), <lbinfo n="meas-ure),"/>

<L>3299<pc>218-a<k1>मुच्<k2>मुच्
{@√muc@}¦ ({@muñcáti, -te@} [<ls n="wg,758">758]</ls>; {@mumóca, mumucé;@} <lbinfo n="mu-mucé;"/>
{@ámucat; mokṣyáti, -te; muktá;@}
{@म्óक्तुम्; मुक्त्वा́; -म्úच्य; मोच्áयति,@}
{@-te@} [<ls n="wg,1041">1041<sup>2</sup></ls>]). release; free; let go; let
loose, <ls n="lan,34,14">34<sup>14</sup></ls>; lay aside; release {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} from
the bonds of sin (<ls n="lan,93,13">93<sup>13</sup></ls>) {%or%} existence; (let
go, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} emit {%or%}) utter, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} sounds; shed
(tears); discharge (phlegm, urine, ordure,
smells). [<ab>orig.</ab> <ab>mg</ab>, ‘to free {%or%} clear’:
specialized in Greek and Latin--‘to clear
the nose, to snot’: <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἀπο-μύσσω, *-μυκ-ϳω</lang>,
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%e-mung-o,%} ‘snot’; <lang n="greek">μυκ-τήρ</lang>, ‘snout,
nose’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%mūc-us,%} ‘snot’: for <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab>
relation of {%snout%} to the cognate verbs {%snot%}
and {%snite.%}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} let out; release.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} let go forth from, release from,
{%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>abl.</ab>%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} loosen, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} a bond ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) from ({%<ab>abl.</ab>%}),
<ls n="lan,79,18">79<sup>18</sup></ls>; untie; free; {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} be freed {%or%} separated  <lbinfo n="sep-arated"/>
from, be deprived of, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>abl.</ab>, but%}
{%also <ab>w.</ab> <ab>instr.</ab>%} (<ls n="wg,283">283<sup>2</sup></ls>). [for last <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab>
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%loose%} with {%lose.%}]

{@mariṣyáti; mṛtá; mártum; mṛtvā́@}).

ϸ, <ab>AS.</ab> {%morðor,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%murther, murder:%}
see {@amṛta.@}]

<L>3337<pc>219-b<k1>मृद्<k2>मृद्
{@√mṛd@}¦ ({@mṛdnā́ti; márdati, -te; mamárda;@}
{@mardiṣyáte; mṛditá; márditum;@}
{@mṛditvā́; -mṛ́dya@}). press {%or%} rub hard,
squeeze, crush, smash, destroy.
[Page220-a+ 50]
<div n="1"/>[extension of {@√२मृ,@} ‘crush’; <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἀ-μαλδ</lang>-
<lang n="greek">ύνω</lang>, ‘destroy’ <ab>e. g.</ab> a wall: <ab>w.</ab> {@मृद्ú,@} ‘soft,
weak,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%mollis, *molvis, *moldv-i-s,%}
‘soft, weak,’ and <lang n="greek">βραδύς, *μραδυς</lang>, ‘slow’
(for <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Ger.</ab> {%weich,%} ‘soft,’ <ab>w.</ab> <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%weak,%} and <ab>Lat.</ab> {%lēn-is,%} ‘soft,’ <ab>w.</ab> {%len-tus,%}
‘slow’):
<div n="1"/>with {@√mṛd@} in hima-mardana, ‘melting
of the snow,’ we might compare <lang n="greek">μέλδω</lang>,
‘melt,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%melt;%} but the {%s%} of the collateral  <lbinfo n="col-lateral"/>
form {%smelt%} makes this doubtful:
see also {@mradas.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} destroy.
<LEND>

<L>3364<pc>220-b<k1>य<k2>य/
{@yá@}¦ [<ls n="wg,509">509]</ls>, {%relative <ab>pron.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} who, which;
{%sometimes following its correlative:%} <ls n="lan,7,6">7<sup>6</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,17,18">17<sup>18</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,29,5">29<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,30,15">30<sup>15</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,33,16">33<sup>16</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,52,7">52<sup>7</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,73,9">73<sup>9</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,78,10">78<sup>10</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,79,7">79<sup>7</sup></ls>;

tam doctus…qui possit, <ls n="lan,19,4">19<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%but%}
{%much oftener preceding its correlative:%} {@ya@}
{@…त,@} <ls n="lan,77,12">77<sup>12</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,69,7">69<sup>7</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,3,13">3<sup>13</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,17,13">17<sup>13</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,21,23">21<sup>23</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,22,4">22<sup>4</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,30,11">30<sup>11</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,32,10">32<sup>10</sup></ls>; {@या́नि…एषाम्,@} <ls n="lan,74,3">74<sup>3</sup></ls>; {@yac ca_ucyate@}
{@…, एतद् आलस्यवचनम्,@} and (what is
said, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) as for the saying…, that is
[fatalists’] sloth-talk, <ls n="lan,18,8, 11">18<sup>8, 11</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%converting the subject or object of a%}
{%verb into a substantive clause:--sometimes,%}
{%perhaps, merely for metre:%} <ls n="lan,29,3">29<sup>3</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,38,7">38<sup>7</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,58,6">58<sup>6</sup></ls>;

{@पक्षा́ आ́संस्, त्é जीमू́ता अभवन्,@} what
were wings, those became clouds, {%for%} {@té@}
{@पक्षा́ अभवन् जीमू́तास्,@} <ls n="lan,93,3">93<sup>3</sup></ls>; {@ayáṃ yó@}
{@ह्óता, क्íर् उ स्á यम्áस्य,@} who this priest
[is], is he also that of Yama, <ls n="lan,88,10">88<sup>10</sup></ls>; {%so%}
{@यद्,@} {%even <ab>w.</ab> words of different gender and%}
{%number, as,%} {@prajā́pater vā́ etáj jyeṣṭháṃ@}
{@तोक्áं, य्áत् प्áर्वतास्,@} of P. that [was] the
first creation, what the mountains are,
<ls n="lan,92,19">92<sup>19</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,95,15">95<sup>15</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,97,1">97<sup>1</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—4.@} which, what, {%as <ab>adj.</ab> <ab>pron.</ab> agreeing%}
{%<ab>w.</ab> incorporated antecedent:%} {@ná_asmai vidyút @} <lbinfo n="vid-yút"/>
{@siṣedha, ná yā́m míham ákirad@}
{@ध्राद्úनिं च,@} not for him did the lightning  <lbinfo n="light-ning"/>
avail, not what mist he scattered
abroad, and hail, <ls n="lan,71,4">71<sup>4</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,71,20">71<sup>20</sup></ls> {%to%} <ls n="lan,72,2">72<sup>2</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,74,4">74<sup>4</sup></ls>,

{%not being expressed,%} <ls n="lan,74,1, 2">74<sup>1, 2</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,78,18">78<sup>18</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—5.@} {@ya@} {%in special connections:%} {@ya ya@}
[<ls n="wg,511">511]</ls>, whoever, whichever, whatever, whosoever, <lbinfo n="who-soever,"/>
 <ab>etc.</ab>, <ls n="lan,13,12">13<sup>12</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,45,13">45<sup>13</sup></ls>; {%so%} {@य क च,@} <ls n="lan,68,10">68<sup>10</sup></ls>;

quīlibet, <ls n="lan,21,11">21<sup>11</sup></ls>; {%so%} {@य त,@} <ls n="lan,18,4">18<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} {%two or%}
{%more relatives in the same clause:%} {@yo 'tti@}
{@यस्य यदा मांसम्,@} when (who) someone  <lbinfo n="some-one"/>
eats the flesh of (whom) someone,
<ls n="lan,29,7">29<sup>7</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,37,11">37<sup>11</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,66,18">66<sup>18</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—७।@} {@य,@} if anybody,
si quis ({%really an anacoluthon%}): {%so%} <ls n="lan,79,16">79<sup>16</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—८।@} {@य, अन्द्…हे,@} <ls n="lan,74,15">74<sup>15</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—9.@} {%for further%}
{%illustration, see%} <ls n="wg,512">512</ls>, <ls n="wg,511">511</ls>; {%for derivatives,%}
<ls n="wg,510">510</ls>; {%for influence on the accent of the verb,%}
<ls n="wg,595">595</ls>; {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@yad, yasmāt, yāt, yena.@}
<div n="1"/>[<ab>orig.</ab> and primarily a demonstrative
(like <ab>Eng.</ab> {%that%} and <ab>Ger.</ab> {%der%}): <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὅς</lang>, ‘he,’
in <lang n="greek">ἦ δ᾽ ὅς</lang>, ‘said he’; <lang n="greek">ὥς</lang>, ‘so,’ in <lang n="greek">οὐδ᾽ὥς</lang>,

(like <ab>Eng.</ab> {%that%} and <ab>Ger.</ab> {%der%}): <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὅς, ἅ</lang> or
<lang n="greek">ἥ, ὅ</lang> for <lang n="greek">*ὅδ</lang>, ‘who, which’; hence {@या́त्,@}

with which <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὡς</lang>, ‘as’; --but these comparisons  <lbinfo n="com-parisons"/>
are rejected in toto by some.]

<L>3369<pc>221-b<k1>यज्<k2>यज्
{@√yaj@}¦ ({@yájati, -te; iyā́ja, ījé@} [<ls n="wg,784">784<sup>3</sup></ls>];

{@yáṣṭum; iṣṭvā́;@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} {@yājáyati@}). honor
a god ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,99,12">99<sup>12</sup></ls>; worship; worship
with prayer and oblation ({%<ab>instr.</ab>%}); {%and so%}

{%Veda, active, when one honors or sacrifices%}
{%(<ab>e. g.</ab>, as a paid priest) on account of another,%}
{%and middle, when one sacrifices on one's%}
{%own account;%} {@य्áजमान,@} {%as <ab>m.</ab>%} one who
institutes {%or%} performs a sacrifice and pays
the expenses of it; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause {%or%} help
{%or%} teach a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) to worship with
a certain sacrifice ({%<ab>instr.</ab>%}); serve a person
as sacrificing priest. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἅγ-ος</lang>, ‘worship,
sacred awe, expiatory sacrifice’; <lang n="greek">ἅζομαι</lang>,
<lang n="greek">*ἁγ-ϳομαι</lang>, ‘stand in awe of,’ <ab>e. g.</ab> gods;
<lang n="greek">ἁγ-νός</lang>, ‘worshipped, hallowed’; <ab>w.</ab> yajya, <lbinfo n="yaj-ya,"/>
 ‘colendus,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἅγ-ιος</lang>, ‘to be worshipped, <lbinfo n="wor-shipped,"/>
 holy’: different is <lang n="greek">ἄγος</lang>, see
{@āgas.@}]

({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) for a person ({%<ab>dat.</ab>%}), einem etwas
er-opfern.

<L>3383<pc>222-a<k1>यत्<k2>यत्
{@√yat@}¦ ({@yátati, -te; yaté; áyatiṣṭa;@}

{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} (cause to attain, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) requite with
reward {%or%} punishment. [perhaps <ab>orig.</ab>
‘reach out after’ and akin <ab>w.</ab> {@√yam.@}]

<L>3389<pc>222-b<k1>यथा<k2>य/था
{@य्áथा,@}¦ {%rel. <ab>adv.</ab> and <ab>conj.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} in which
way, as; {%sometimes following its correlative:%}
{@तथा…यथा,@} <ls n="lan,22,14">22<sup>14</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,43,20">43<sup>20</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,44,20">44<sup>20</sup></ls>; {@evam@}
{@…यथा,@} <ls n="lan,37,8">37<sup>8</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%but much oftener preceding %} <lbinfo n="pre-ceding"/>
{%its correlative:%} {@teṣāṃ saṃ hanmo@}
{@अक्षाणि, यथा_इदं हर्मिअं, तथा,@}
of them we close the eyes, as (we close)
this house, so, <ls n="lan,77,13">77<sup>13</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,61,6">61<sup>6</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,27,14">27<sup>14</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,21,16, 18">21<sup>16, 18</sup></ls>,

{@…eva@} ({%Vedic%}), <ls n="lan,86,12, 13">86<sup>12, 13</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—३।@} {%चोर्रेलतिवे ओमित्तेद्:%} {@बुद्धिम् प्रकुरुष्व,@} <lbinfo n="pra-kuruṣva,"/>
{@यथा_इच्छसि,@} decide (so), as
thou wishest, <ls n="lan,9,11">9<sup>11</sup></ls>; <ls n="lan,5,20">5<sup>20</sup></ls>, <ab>etc.</ab>; {%so with verbs%}
{%of saying, <ab>etc.</ab>:%} {@tad brūhi, yathā…@}
{@उपदधाम,@} this tell us ({%viz.%} the way)
in which we are to put on…, <ls n="lan,96,14">96<sup>14</sup></ls>; {%so%}
<ls n="lan,88,6, 7">88<sup>6, 7</sup></ls>;

{%of comparison,%} as, like, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} <ls n="lan,6,19">6<sup>19</sup></ls>; {%so enclitic%}
{%at end of a%} {@पाद,@} <ls n="lan,71,12, 15">71<sup>12, 15</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,87,11">87<sup>11</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,1,5">1<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,2,9">2<sup>9</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,31,1">31<sup>1</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,43,4">43<sup>4</sup></ls>; {%in solemn declarations:%} {@यथा…,@}
{@तेन सत्येन,@} as surely as…, so, <ls n="lan,13,23">13<sup>23</sup></ls><ab>ff.</ab>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—5.@} {%combinations%} ({%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@ya@} 5); {@yathā@}
{@यथा…तथा तथा,@} according as…so,
the more…the more, <ls n="lan,48,13">48<sup>13</sup></ls>; {@यथा तथा,@}
[Page223-a+ 50]
in some way or other ({%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@ya@} 5 end), at
any rate, <ls n="lan,62,9">62<sup>9</sup></ls>;

that: {%in Veda, <ab>w.</ab> subjunctive,%} <ls n="lan,88,14">88<sup>14</sup></ls>,

act so, that the master wakes, <ls n="lan,30,16">30<sup>16</sup></ls>; {%so%}

<L>3408<pc>223-b<k1>यद्<k2>य/द्
{@य्áद्,@}¦ <div n="2"/>{@—१।@} {%अस् <ab>नोम्।</ab> <ab>अच्च्।</ab> <ab>स्।</ab> <ab>न्।</ab> तो%} {@य,@} {%see%} {@ya;@}
{%used in <ab>cpds</ab> and derivs, see%} <ls n="wg,510">510</ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%as%}
{%conjunctive <ab>adv.</ab>%} that; {@tan na bhadraṃ@}
{@कृतं, यद् विश्वासः कृतस्,@} therefore
it was not well done (herein), that trust
was reposed, <ls n="lan,22,17">22<sup>17</sup></ls>; {@niṇyā ciketa, pṛśnir@}
{@यद् ऊधो जभार,@} he knoweth the
secret, that P. offered her udder, <ls n="lan,78,3">78<sup>3</sup></ls>;
{%introducing oratio recta,%} <ls n="lan,38,1">38<sup>1</sup></ls>; {@यद्…, तद्,@}
as for the fact that…, therein, <ls n="lan,36,1">36<sup>1</sup></ls>; {%so%}
<ls n="lan,94,16">94<sup>16</sup></ls>; {@यद् वै तद् अब्रुवन्,@} as for the
fact that they said thát, indeed, <ls n="lan,96,23">96<sup>23</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%in causal connections: like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} that
({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} on account of which), <ls n="lan,78,16">78<sup>16</sup></ls>; {@yad…@}
{@तद्,@} since…therefore, <ls n="lan,17,5">17<sup>5</sup></ls>; {@yad…@}
{@तस्मात्,@} inasmuch as…therefore, <ls n="lan,15,3">15<sup>3</sup></ls>;
since ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} considering that), <ls n="lan,79,14">79<sup>14</sup></ls>; {%purpose:%} <lbinfo n="pur-pose:%"/>
in order that, <ls n="lan,78,9">78<sup>9</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,72,12, 14">72<sup>12, 14</sup></ls>; {%result:%}
that, <ls n="lan,71,6, 7">71<sup>6, 7</sup></ls>; {@etāḍṛśā dharmajñā, yan@}
{@मां हन्तुम् उद्यतास्,@} so understanding
the law, as to undertake to slay me,
<ls n="lan,28,5">28<sup>5</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—४।@} {%तेम्पोरल्:%} अस्, <ls n="lan,86,6">८६<sup>६</sup></ls>; {@तद्…यद्,@}
then…when, <ls n="lan,71,2">71<sup>2</sup></ls>; {@यद्…ततस्,@} when
…then, <ls n="lan,92,12">92<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%so%} {@यद्…तादीत्ना,@} <ls n="lan,70,7">70<sup>7</sup></ls>;
{%<ab>correl.</ab> often lacking:%} {@यद्…, …,@} when…,
({%<ab>sc.</ab>%} then), <ls n="lan,75,12">75<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%so%} <ls n="lan,80,3">80<sup>3</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,81,17">81<sup>17</sup></ls>; while, <ls n="lan,71,5">71<sup>5</sup></ls>;
{%--hence, the temporal use passing insensibly%}
({%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@यद् वशाम,@} when {%or%} if we will, <ls n="lan,73,17">73<sup>17</sup></ls>,
{%and <ab>Eng.</ab>%} when {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>Ger.</ab>%} wenn) {%into the%}
{%conditional,%} <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} if, <ls n="lan,80,9, 10, 11">80<sup>9, 10, 11</sup></ls>; {@--yad@} {%placed%}

<L>3436<pc>225-b<k1>यु<k2>यु<h>1

{@yuté; yuváti, -te;@} {%finite forms Vedic%}

{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} having reference to, <ls n="lan,59,14">59<sup>14</sup></ls>.

<L>3476<pc>227-a<k1>रक्ष्<k2>रक्ष्<h>1
{@√1rakṣ@}¦ ({@rákṣati, -te; rarákṣa; árakṣīt;@}
{@rakṣitá; rákṣitum; -rákṣya@}). de-fend,
protect; keep, {%<ab>i. e.</ab> both%} retain {%and%} maintain; <lbinfo n="main-tain;"/>
 take care of (as a sovereign), {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
govern; guard, ward; save. [a <ab>desid.</ab>
extension of {@√*rak@} or {@ark:@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἀλέξ-ω</lang>,
‘ward off,’ which bears a similar relation
to <lang n="greek">√ἀλκ</lang> or <lang n="greek">ἀρκ</lang> in <lang n="greek">ἄλ-αλκ-ε</lang>, ‘warded off,’
<lang n="greek">ἀρκ-έω</lang>, ‘ward off, protect’; <ab>cf.</ab> also <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%arc-eo,%} ‘ward off,’ {%arx,%} ‘stronghold of defence, <lbinfo n="de-fence,"/>
 citadel’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%ealh-stede,%} ‘defencestead, <lbinfo n="‘defence-stead,"/>
 strong-hold’; {%ealgian,%} ‘protect’:
for the two chief <ab>mgs</ab> of {@√रक्ष्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%de-fendere,%} ‘ward off, protect.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} protect around; save.

<L>3488<pc>227-b<k1>रजस्<k2>र/जस्
{@र्áजस्,@}¦ {%<ab>n.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} atmosphere, air, region of
clouds, vapors, and gloom, clearly distinguished  <lbinfo n="dis-tinguished"/>
from heaven ({@द्यौस्,@} <ls n="lan,72,2">72<sup>2</sup></ls>) or
[Page228-a+ 50]
the ethereal spaces of heaven ({@rocanā@}
{@दिवस्,@} <ls n="lan,81,8">81<sup>8</sup></ls>, or {@svar@}), “where the light
dwelleth,” these being beyond the {@रजस्,@}
just as the <lang n="greek">αἰθήρ</lang> is beyond the <lang n="greek">ἀήρ</lang>;
{%used loosely in <ab>pl.</ab>,%} the skies, <ls n="lan,71,7">71<sup>7</sup></ls>; the

dust, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} <ls n="lan,14,13">14<sup>13</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} {%in the philosophical%}

‘passion’), <ls n="lan,66,8, 16">66<sup>8, 16</sup></ls>.

usage, is ‘the cloudy (region), region of
gloom and dark’ as distinguished from

<L>3518<pc>229-a<k1>राज्<k2>राज्
{@√rāj@}¦ ({@rā́jati, -te; rarā́ja, rejé@} [<ls n="wg,794">794e<sup>2</sup></ls>];
{@árājīt@}).
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—1.@} direct; rule; be first; be master
{%or%} king of, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>gen.</ab>;%}
<div n="1"/><div n="2"/>{@—2.@} shine; be illustrious; distinguish
one's self; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to shine.
[Page229-b+ 50]
<div n="1"/>[<ab>orig.</ab>, perhaps, two distinct roots,
but no longer distinguished in form,
and with the two sets of <ab>mgs</ab> partly coincident:  <lbinfo n="co-incident:"/>
<ab>w.</ab> {@राज्@} १, <ab>च्ड़्।</ab> {@√१ऋज्,@} ‘reach out’;
<ab>w.</ab> {@राज्@} २, <ab>च्ड़्।</ab> {@√३ऋज्,@} ‘be bright,’ and {@√raj:@}
see under {@rājan.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} become master of, master ({%<ab>gen.</ab>%}),
<ls n="lan,81,11">81<sup>11</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} shine out; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} adorn, <ls n="lan,12,17">12<sup>17</sup></ls>.

<L>3565<pc>231-a<k1>रुध्<k2>रुध्<h>1
{@√१रुध्@}¦ {@(रुण्áद्धि, रुन्द्ध्é; रुर्óध,@}
{@रुरुध्é; áरौत्सीत्, áरुद्ध; रोत्स्य्áति,@} <lbinfo n="rotsyá-ti,"/>
{@-te; ruddhá; róddhum; ruddhvā́;@}
{@-rúdhya). --1.@} hold back; obstruct;
hold; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} keep off; hinder; suppress;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} shut up; close.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} {%as <ab>pass.</ab>, or <ab>mid.</ab> <ab>intrans.</ab>, <ab>i. e.</ab> as of%}
{%the%} {@य्á-@} {%ओर्%} {@य@}-{%च्लस्स्,%} {@अनुरुध्यते,@} {%also%} {@-ति,@}
be held to, keep one's self to; be devoted
to, practice, <ls n="lan,10,13">10<sup>13</sup></ls>; have regard for.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अव,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} hold off; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} (hold
apart for one's self, lay up, {%and so%})
[Page231-b+ 50]
obtain; {%--<ab>desid.</ab> <ab>mid.</ab>%} desire to obtain,
<ls n="lan,96,11">96<sup>11</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} hold; stop; shut up.
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} hinder {%or%} disturb.

<L>3566<pc>231-b<k1>रुध्<k2>रुध्<h>2
{@√2rudh@}¦ ({@ródhati@}). grow. [collateral form
of {@√रुह्,@} <ab>q. v.</ab>: <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%rud-is,%} <ab>fem.</ab>, ‘rod,
staff’: for <ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>w.</ab> {@√rudh@} and <ab>Ger.</ab>

<ab>Eng.</ab> {%rod,%} ‘a growing shoot, rod, measure
of length,’ older {%rood,%} ‘measure of length
{%or%} surface,’ is improbable on account of
the {%ō%} of <ab>AS.</ab> {%rōd.%}]

<L>3569<pc>231-b<k1>रुह्<k2>रुह्
{@√ruh@}¦ ({@róhati, -te; ruróha, ruruhé;@}

<div n="p"/>{@+ अधि,@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause ({%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} one's body,

<ls n="lan,48,15">48<sup>15</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} mount {%or%} get upon (a stone); seat

(the head, hill-top, life, place); embark

into (wagon, boat), {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> of person and%}

<L>3600<pc>233-a<k1>लघु<k2>लघु/
{@लघ्ú,@}¦ {%younger form of%} {@रघ्ú,@} {%<ab>a.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@}
swift, quick; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} light, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} not heavy;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} (light, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) insignificant; small;
contemptible; low.
<div n="1"/>[for derivation, see {@raghú@} and {@√raṃh:@}
<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἐ-λαχύ-ς</lang>, ‘small,’ <lang n="greek">ἐλάχιστος</lang>, ‘smallest’;
Lithuanian {%lèngvas,%} ‘light’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%lĕvis,%}
{%*lenhu-i-s ?,%} ‘1. swift, 2. light, not heavy,
3. insignificant, small’ (<ab>mgs</ab> quite parallel
<ab>w.</ab> those of {@laghu@}); <ab>AS.</ab> {%lung-re,%} ‘quickly’;
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%lungs,%} ‘lights’: kinship of <ab>AS.</ab> {%leōh-t,%}
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%light,%} ‘not heavy,’ {%lights,%} ‘lungs,’ not
certain: for connection of <ab>mgs</ab> 1 and 2,
observe that {%swift%} and {%light,%} just as
{%slow%} and {%heavy,%} name qualities naturally
associated: for {%light,%} ‘not dark,’ see
{@√ruc.@}]
<LEND>
<L>3601<pc>233-a<k1>लघुक्रम<k2>लघु-क्रम

<L>3766<pc>240-b<k1>वह्<k2>वह्
{@√vah@}¦ ({@váhati, -te; uvā́ha, ūhé; ávākṣīt;@}
{@vakṣyáti; ūḍhá@} [<ls n="wg,222">222]</ls>; {@vóḍhum; ūḍhvā́;@}
{@-úhya; uhyáte@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} conduct, <ls n="lan,84,11">84<sup>11</sup></ls>;
carry, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} the oblation, <ls n="lan,85,1">85<sup>1</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,93,14">93<sup>14</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,94,1">94<sup>1</sup></ls>;
bring with team, <ls n="lan,73,11">73<sup>11</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,81,14">81<sup>14</sup></ls>, {%or%} car, <ls n="lan,72,4">72<sup>4</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,87,14">87<sup>14</sup></ls>; draw (wagon), guide (horses); <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
{%<ab>intrans.</ab>%} travel; proceed (in a wagon);
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%<ab>pass.</ab>%} be borne along; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} flow,
carry with itself (of water); <div n="2"/>{@—5.@} ({%like%}
{%<ab>Ger.</ab>%} heimführen) bring home to the
groom's house, wed; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} carry, <ls n="lan,43,11, 16">43<sup>11, 16</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,52,9">52<sup>9</sup></ls>; bear, <ls n="lan,26,4">26<sup>4</sup></ls>; carry far and wide, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
spread (a poem, fragrance), <ls n="lan,54,2">54<sup>2</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[for {@*vagh:@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὄχος, *ϝοχος</lang>, ‘wagon’;
<lang n="greek">ὀχέομαι</lang>, ‘ride’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%veh-ere,%} ‘carry’; {%vehiculum,%} <lbinfo n="vehi-culum,"/>
‘wagon’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%weg-an,%} ‘carry, bear,’
whence <ab>Eng.</ab> {%weigh,%} ‘lift’ (as in {%weigh%}
{%anchor%}), ‘find weight of by lifting’ (<ab>cf.</ab>
{@bhara@}); <ab>AS.</ab> {%wægn%} or {%wǣn,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%wain,%}
Dutch {%wagen%} (whence the borrowed <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%wagon%}), ‘that which is drawn, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} wagon’;
further, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vi-a, ve-a, *veh-ia,%} ‘that which
is to be travelled over, way’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%weg,%}
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%way,%} ‘that which carries’ one to a
place.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} bring hither {%or%} to.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} bear {%or%} bring up; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>esp.</ab>%}
lead out (a bride from her father's house),
wed.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} lead about; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} lead
about (the bride {%or%} the wedding procession), <lbinfo n="proces-sion),"/>
 wed.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} carry onward.
[Page241-a+ 50]
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} lead away, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} the bride from her
parents’ house, {%and so%} wed, marry; {%<ab>mid.</ab>%}
get married.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} carry together; carry.
<LEND>

<L>3771<pc>241-a<k1>वा<k2>वा<h>1
{@√1vā@}¦ ({@vā́ti; vavaú; ávāsīt@} [<ls n="wg,882">882]</ls>; {@vāsyáti;@} <lbinfo n="vās-yáti;"/>
{@vātá; vā́tum; vāpáyati@} [<ls n="wg,1042">1042d</ls>]).
blow. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἄημι, *ἀ-ϝη-μι</lang>, ‘blow’; <ab>Goth.</ab>
{%va-ian,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%weh-en,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%wāwan,%} ‘blow’;
<lang n="greek">αὔ-ρα</lang>, ‘breeze’; <lang n="greek">ἀήρ, *ἀϝηρ</lang>, ‘air’; <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%ventu-s%} (a participial form which has
made a transition to the vowel-declension
--<ab>cf.</ab> {@vasanta@} and <ls n="wg,1172">1172<sup>3, 4</sup></ls>), ‘wind,’ <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%wind;%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%we-der,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%wea-ther,%} ‘wind
(<ab>e. g.</ab> in {%weather-cock%}), condition of the air’:
see {@वा́त@} अन्द् {@वाय्ú,@} ‘wind.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} blow hither.
<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} (blow out, {%intransitively, <ab>i. e.</ab>%})
go out, be extinguished; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}
(blow till one gets one's breath, {%and so%})
cool off; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} extinguish; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
cool off, {%transitively, <ab>i. e.</ab>%} refresh.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परा,@} blow away.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} blow {%or%} move forward, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} blow asunder, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} scatter to the
winds.
<LEND>
<L>3772<pc>241-a<k1>वा<k2>वा<h>2
{@√2vā@}¦ ({@váyati@} [<ls n="wg,761">761</ls>ḍ]; {@uvā́ya@} [<ls n="wg,784">784<sup>2</sup></ls>];
{@vayiṣyáti; utá; ótum; ūyáte@}). weave,
interweave, {%both <ab>lit.</ab>, and also%} ({%like <ab>Lat.</ab>%}
serere), {%<ab>fig.</ab>,%} of hymns and songs; plait.
[<ab>orig.</ab> idea perhaps ‘wind’ or ‘plait’:
root-forms are {@उ, वा,@} and {@vi:@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἰτέα</lang>,
<lang n="greek">*ϝῑτεα</lang>, ‘willow’; <lang n="greek">οἶσος</lang>, ‘osier’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vi-ēre,%}
‘plait’; {%vī-men,%} ‘plaited work’; <lang n="greek">οἴνη</lang>,
‘vine’; <lang n="greek">οἶνος</lang>, ‘wine’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vīnum,%} ‘wine’;
{%vī-tis,%} ‘vine,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%withy%} or {%withe,%} ‘pliant
twig,’ <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Weide,%} ‘withe, willow.’]
<LEND>

<L>3810<pc>242-b<k1>वाश्<k2>वाश्

<L>3845<pc>243-b<k1>विद्<k2>विद्<h>1
{@√1vid@}¦ ({@vétti; véda@} [<ls n="wg,790">790a</ls>]; {@ávedīt;@}
{@vediṣyáti, -te; vetsyáti, -te; viditá;@}
{@véditum, véttum; viditvā́; -vídya; vedáyati@} <lbinfo n="ve-dáyati"/>
). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} know; understand; perceive; <lbinfo n="per-ceive;"/>
 ya evaṃ veda, who knoweth thus,
who hath this knowledge, {%frequent formula%}
{%in the Brāhmanas,%} <ls n="lan,97,3">97<sup>3</sup></ls>; {@विद्यात्,@} one should
know, it should be known {%or%} understood;
<div n="2"/>{@—२।@} रेचोग्निज़े अस्; {@नलम् मां विद्धि,@}
[Page244-a+ 50]
recognize me as <ab>N.</ab>, know that I am <ab>N.</ab>;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} notice; be mindful of, <ls n="lan,75,13">75<sup>13</sup></ls>; bethink
one's self, <ls n="lan,94,6, 10">94<sup>6, 10</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} believe; assume;
consider a person ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}) to be…({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}),
<ls n="lan,43,19">43<sup>19</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>ppl.</ab>%} {@विद्वा́ंस्,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%}
<div n="1"/>[with {@व्éद, विद्म्á,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">οἶδα, ἴδμεν</lang>, <ab>AS.</ab>
{%ic wāt, wē witon,%} ‘I know, we know’; <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%I wot,%} gerund {%to wit,%} noun {%wit,%} ‘understanding’:  <lbinfo n="‘under-standing’:"/>
<ab>cf.</ab> also <lang n="greek">εἶδον, *ἐϝιδον</lang>, ‘saw’;
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%vidēre,%} ‘see’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%wītan,%} ‘see’;
whence {%wīt-ga,%} ‘seer, soothsayer, wizard’
(Icelandie {%vit-ki,%} ‘wizard’), {%wicca,%} ‘wizard,’
{%wicce,%} ‘witch,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%witch,%} <ab>masc.</ab> and <ab>fem.</ab>:
{@véda@} is an old preterito-present, ‘have
seen {%or%} perceived,’ and so, ‘know’--see
{@√2vid:@} the forms of the other tense-systems
are comparatively modern.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} know along, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} from one end to
the other, know thoroughly.
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to know; do to wit;
announce; communicate.
<LEND>

<L>3959<pc>248-a<k1>विष्णु<k2>वि/ष्णु

one of the Hindu Trinity, and extremely
important in the later sectarian development  <lbinfo n="devel-opment"/>
of India; {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@brahmán@} 2 {%and%}
{@शिव्á।@} [<ab>प्रोब्।</ab> ‘थे मिघ्त्य् wओर्केर्,’ {@√विष्,@}
<ls n="wg,1162">1162.</ls>]
<LEND>

<L>3970<pc>248-b<k1>वी<k2>वी<h>1
{@√1vī@}¦ ({@véti; vivā́ya, vivyé; vītá@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@}
seek eagerly; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} accept gladly; enjoy;
<div n="2"/>{@—3.@} strive to get; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} fall upon.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vēnāri,%} ‘hunt,’ a <ab>denom.</ab> of
{%*vē-na,%} ‘hunt’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%wā-ð,%} ‘hunt’; Old
High <ab>Ger.</ab> {%weida,%} ‘1. the seeking, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%} of
food, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} hunting, fishing, {%and then%} 2. place
for getting food, pasture, {%and%} 3. food,
fodder’; {%weida%} appears <ab>w.</ab> <ab>mg</ab> 1 in <ab>Ger.</ab>
{%Waid-mann,%} ‘hunter’ (also as family
name, {%Weidmann,%} ‘Hunter’), and <ab>w.</ab> <ab>mgs</ab>
2 and 3 in {%Weide,%} ‘pasture, food’: perhaps  <lbinfo n="per-haps"/>
{@२व्áयस्,@} ‘food,’ <ab>q. v.</ab>, comes <ab>fr.</ab> {@√vī@}
in <ab>mg</ab> 1, ‘seek for, hunt,’ and in this case
the development of <ab>mg</ab> is like that of
{%weida%} 3 and like that of <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vēnātiōn-em,%}
‘hunting, game,’ whence <ab>Eng.</ab> {%venison.%}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप,@} seek after.
