<L>3985<pc>249-a<k1>वृ<k2>वृ<h>1
{@√1vṛ@}¦ {@(vṛṇóti, vṛṇuté; vavā́ra, vavré;@}
{@ávārīt; vṛtá; váritum, vártum; vṛtvā́;@}
{@-vṛ́tya; vāráyati). --1.@} cover, enclose,
encompass; surround, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} guard, <ls n="lan,11,21">11<sup>21</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%offensively,%} keep in, hold back {%or%}
captive; {@वृत,@} pent up, <ls n="lan,75,14">75<sup>14</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%defensively,%} <lbinfo n="de-fensively,"/>
hold back, keep in check (<ls n="lan,75,11">75<sup>11</sup></ls>),
ward off, hinder, restrain; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%}
[<ls n="wg,1041">1041<sup>2</sup></ls>], keep back, hinder, stop.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἐ-ελ-μένος</lang>, ‘enclosed’ and ‘held in
check,’ referred to <lang n="greek">εἴλω</lang>, Aeolic <lang n="greek">ἔλλω</lang>,
<lang n="greek">*ϝελ-νω; εἶλαρ, *ϝελ-αρ</lang>, ‘cover, defense’;
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%ver-ēri,%} ‘be on one's guard, fear’;
{%vellus,%} ‘(cover, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) pelt, fleece’; {%vallum,%}
‘defense, palisaded rampart, wall,’ whence
the borrowed <ab>Eng.</ab> {%wall;%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%ware, wary,%}
‘on one's guard, cautious’; <ab>Ger.</ab> {%wehren,%}
‘check, ward off’; {%Wehre,%} ‘defense’;
with {@व्áर्त्र,@} ‘stopping,’ and then ‘a dam,’
cf <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Wehr,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%wer,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%weir,%} ‘(water-)
stop, dam’: for other cognates, see {@उरु,@}
{@ऊर्ण, वरुण:@} <ab>च्ड़्।</ab> थे देरिव्स् {@वल, वृत्र,@}
{@वरूथ, वर्ण,@} <ab>etc.</ab>]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} cover over.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अप,@} uncover, open. [<ab>cf.</ab> the relation
of <ab>Ger.</ab> {%decken,%} ‘cover,’ and {%auf-decken,%}
‘uncover.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभि,@} cover.
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} cover; {@--āvṛta:@} covered, <ls n="lan,33,20">33<sup>20</sup></ls>; concealed; <lbinfo n="con-cealed;"/>
 encompassed, surrounded, <ls n="lan,3,9">3<sup>9</sup></ls>;
[Page249-b+ 50]
(covered with, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) filled with, provided
with, <ls n="lan,66,1">66<sup>1</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-आ,@} cover; {@समावृत,@} surrounded.
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} keep down, suppress, ward off;
{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} [<ls n="wg,1041">1041<sup>2</sup></ls>], stop, <ls n="lan,98,4">98<sup>4</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} {%in <ab>ppl.</ab>%} {@निर्वृत,@} pleased, contented, <lbinfo n="con-tented,"/>
 free from care. [<ab>prop.</ab> ‘uncovcred, <lbinfo n="‘uncov-cred,"/>
 not covered over, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} not dark {%or%}
gloomy,’ and so ‘clear, bright’: <ab>cf.</ab>
{@√१वृ + वि,@} which shows a similar metaphor. <lbinfo n="meta-phor."/>
]
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} surround.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} cover.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-प्र,@} {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} cover completely.
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} uncover, open; make open {%or%} clear,
illume. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@√1vṛ + nis.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} cover over; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} keep together  <lbinfo n="to-gether"/>
{%or%} in order, {%and so%} put in order,
gather up, <ls n="lan,26,20">26<sup>20</sup></ls>.

<L>3986<pc>249-b<k1>वृ<k2>वृ<h>2

<L>3996<pc>250-a<k1>वृत्<k2>वृत्
{@√vṛt@}¦ ({@vártate, -ti; vavárta, vāvṛté@} [<ls n="wg,786">786]</ls>;
{@ávṛtat; vartiṣyáti, -te; vartsyáti, -te;@}

({%<ab>abl.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,76,14">76<sup>14</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} ({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} take its
course) go on, take place; happen; {@ekāpāyena @} <lbinfo n="ekā-pāyena"/>
{@वृत्,@} go with a diminution-by-one,
{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} decrease by one, <ls n="lan,58,5">58<sup>5</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} (move
one's self about in a place, {%and so%}) abide,
exist, be, be present; {@मूर्ध्नि वृत्,@} stand
at the head, be chief in importance, <ls n="lan,22,21">22<sup>21</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—4.@} be in a certain condition, case, occupation; <lbinfo n="occu-pation;"/>
 be concerned with ({%<ab>loc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,10,5">10<sup>5</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—5.@} live; live by ({%<ab>instr.</ab>%}), {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} live upon,
<ls n="lan,104,2">104<sup>2</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—6.@} proceed, behave; <div n="2"/>{@—7.@} {%attenuated %} <lbinfo n="atten-uated"/>
{%in <ab>mg</ab> from sense%} 3 {%to that of a simple%}
{%copula,%} be, <ls n="lan,51,4">51<sup>4</sup></ls>; {@--वृत्त्á,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%}
<div n="1"/>[<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%vert-ere,%} ‘turn’; <ab>AS.</ab> {%weorðan,%}
‘become,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%worth,%} ‘become, be to’ (in
[Page250-b+ 50]
{%wo worth the day%}), <ab>Ger.</ab> {%werden,%} ‘become’;
for transition of <ab>mg</ab> in <ab>Eng.</ab> and <ab>Ger.</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab>
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%turn,%} which also means ‘become’ (as
in {%turn traitor%}): --<ab>cf.</ab> also <ab>Eng.</ab> {%-ward,%} as
in {%go south-ward,%} <ab>i. e.</ab> ‘turned to the south,’
{%fly up-ward,%} <ab>i. e.</ab> ‘directed up,’ <ab>etc.</ab> (see
{@añc@}); also <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Wirt-el,%} ‘spindle-ring’;
Church Slavonic {%vret-eno,%} ‘spindle’:
<div n="1"/>--further akin is, <ab>prob.</ab>, <ab>AS.</ab> {%wrīðan,%}
‘twist,’ whence come: <ab>Eng.</ab> {%writhe;%} <ab>AS.</ab>
{%wrǣð,%} ‘a twisted band,’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%wreath; wrist,%}
earlier {%hand-wrist, *-wrið-st,%} ‘hand-turner’:
<div n="1"/>--with {@वृत्त्á,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%versus,%} ‘turned,’
whence {%versāre,%} ‘turn much’: for <ab>mgs</ab>
3-6 of {@वृत्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab> {%versāri,%} whose senses
are quite parallel, and the <ab>Eng.</ab> phrase
“in whom we live and {%move%} and have our
being.”]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} roll after; follow; {%and so,%} continue. <lbinfo n="con-tinue."/>

<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} {%<ab>act.</ab>%} turn hither ({%<ab>trans.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,73,6">73<sup>6</sup></ls>; {%so at%}
<ls n="lan,74,11">74<sup>11</sup></ls> ({%<ab>sc.</ab>%} {@र्áथं वस्,@} ‘your car’); {%<ab>mid.</ab>%}
turn ({%<ab>intrans.</ab>%}), roll back, <ls n="lan,63,8">63<sup>8</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उप_आ,@} turn hither unto, <ls n="lan,93,19">93<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभि-पर्य-आ,@} turn around unto.
<div n="p"/>{@+ व्य्-आ,@} turn away, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>;%} separate
from {%or%} part with ({%<ab>instr.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,86,8">86<sup>8</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,96,22">96<sup>22</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्-आ,@} turn back to meet; go home,
{%used <ab>esp.</ab>%} of a religious preceptor's pupil
who has finished his studies.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} turn out (centrifugally), {%<ab>intrans.</ab>,%}
fly asunder; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} burst asunder {%or%} open.
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} turn back; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} flee; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@}
turn away; <div n="2"/>{@—४।@} तुर्न् ड़्रोम्, अब्स्तैन्; {@--निवृत्त,@} <lbinfo n="--ni-vṛtta,"/>
{%see <ab>s. v.</ab>%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्रति-नि,@} turn back from ({%<ab>abl.</ab>%}).
<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} roll out, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>, and so%} ({%with a%}
{%metaphor like that in the <ab>Eng.</ab>%} e-volve itself
{%and <ab>Ger.</ab>%} sich ent-wickeln) develop, come
into being, <ls n="lan,92,13">92<sup>13</sup></ls>; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} e-volve from, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
create from ({%<ab>abl.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,57,16">57<sup>16</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} turn around; move in a circle.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} turn {%or%} move forward; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
set out; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} begin, set about; <div n="2"/>{@—4.@} engage  <lbinfo n="en-gage"/>
in; {@--प्रवृत्त,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>; --<ab>caus.</ab>%} set
in motion.
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} turn away; part with ({%<ab>instr.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,88,3">88<sup>3</sup></ls>;
{%<ab>caus.</ab>%} whirl about, {%<ab>trans.</ab>%}
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} unite, {%<ab>intrans.</ab>, and so%} take shape,
form itself, come into being.

<L>4199<pc>258-b<k1>शिष्<k2>शिष्<h>1
{@√१शिष्@}¦ ({@शिन्áष्टि; शिशिष्é; áशिषत्; शेक्ष्य्áति,@}
{@-te; śiṣṭá; śiṣṭvā́; -śíṣya@}). leave, leave
remaining.

<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} (leave apart {%or%} by itself, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) separate, <lbinfo n="sepa-rate,"/>
 distinguish; {@विशिष्ट,@} (separated, {%and%}
{%so, like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} distinguished) eminent, excellent. <lbinfo n="ex-cellent."/>

<L>4274<pc>260-b<k1>श्रद्<k2>श्र/द्

trust ye him, have faith in him, <ab>RV.</ab> ii.
12. 5; {%<ab>ppl.</ab>%} {@श्रद्-दधत्,@} trusting, trustful,

{%cord-is,%} Lithuanian {%szirdìs,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Herz,%} <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%heart:%} further, <ab>w.</ab> {@श्रद्-धा,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%crēdĕre, *cred-dere,%} ‘trust’: --the regular
<ab>Skt.</ab> word for ‘heart’ is {@हृ́द्,@} and this can
not be connected <ab>w.</ab> the above words,
since they require in the <ab>Skt.</ab> an initial {@श्,@}

<L>4374<pc>265-a<k1>सत्त्व<k2>सत्त्व/
{@सत्त्व्á,@}¦ <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} {%<ab>n.</ab>%} condition of being, beingness, <lbinfo n="being-ness,"/>
 being, existence, essent-ia; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} {%<ab>n.</ab>%}
condition of being good, absolutely good
being, goodness, the highest of the three
qualities ({%see%} {@guṇa@}), <ls n="lan,66,8">66<sup>8</sup></ls><ab>N.</ab>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} {%<ab>m.</ab> <ab>n.</ab>%}
a living being, creature, <ls n="lan,28,14">28<sup>14</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,48,2">48<sup>2</sup></ls>. [formed
from sant (1239), just as the artificial
<ab>Lat.</ab> {%essent-ia,%} ‘being-ness, that on which a
thing depends for being what it is,’ from
{%essens,%} a quasi-<ab>ppl.</ab> of {%esse.%}]

<L>4385<pc>265-b<k1>सद्<k2>सद्
{@√sad@}¦ ({@sī́dati, -te@} [<ls n="wg,748">748]</ls>; {@sasā́da, sedús@}
[<ls n="wg,794">794e</ls>]; {@ásadat; satsyáti; sattá, sanná;@}
{@sáttum; -sádya; sādáyati, -te@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@}
sit; seat one's self; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} settle down,
sink beneath a burden; be overcome;
get into trouble; be in a desperate predicament, <lbinfo n="pre-dicament,"/>
 <ls n="lan,18,7">18<sup>7</sup></ls>; despair; not know what
to do, be unable to help one's self;
{%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} set. [<ab>w.</ab> {@सीदामि, *सि-ज़्द्-आमि,@}
{@सि-स्<sup>अ</sup>द्-आमि,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἵζω, *σι-zδ-ω, *σι-σ<sup>ε</sup>δ-ω</lang>,
‘sit,’ <ab>Lat.</ab> {%sīd-ere,%} ‘settle down’; <ab>cf.</ab> also
{%sed-ēre,%} ‘sit’; <ab>Eng.</ab> {%sit,%} <ab>caus.</ab> {%set;%} {@सद्-अस्,@}
<lang n="greek">ἕδ-ος, ἕδ-ρα</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%sella, *sed-la,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%set-l,%}
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%settle,%} ‘a seat.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अव,@} sink down, get into trouble, be
in distress.
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} sit upon; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} lie in wait for,
<ls n="lan,89,13">89<sup>13</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} get to, reach (a place); {@ā́sanna:@} <lbinfo n="ā́san-na:"/>
approached; near, neighboring, <ls n="lan,33,10">33<sup>10</sup></ls>;
{%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} set upon; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} get to, arrive
at, reach; find, obtain, gain, <ls n="lan,23,11">23<sup>11</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,46,2">46<sup>2</sup></ls>;
<div n="2"/>{@—३।@} {@आसाद्य,@} {%often so attenuated in <ab>mg</ab> as%}
{%to be <ab>equiv.</ab> to a mere preposition:%} {@nimittaṃ@}
{@किंचिद् आसाद्य,@} (having obtained some
cause or other, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) by {%or%} in consequence
of some cause or other, {%<ab>cf.</ab>%} {@√diś + ud.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} sit down; take one's seat, {%<ab>esp.</ab>%}
of the {@hotṛ@} at the sacrifice, <ls n="lan,88,6, 8">88<sup>6, 8</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}
{%<ab>act.</ab> and <ab>mid.</ab>%} set, install as, {%<ab>trans.</ab>!,%}
<ls n="lan,82,12">82<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>caus.</ab> <ab>act.</ab> and <ab>mid.</ab>%} set, install as,
<ls n="lan,88,17">88<sup>17</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} be favorable {%or%} gracious; {@प्रसन्न,@} <lbinfo n="pra-sanna,"/>
kindly disposed, <ls n="lan,1,17">1<sup>17</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} make
kindly disposed, propitiate, <ls n="lan,36,6">36<sup>6</sup></ls>. [behind
the <ab>mg</ab> ‘be gracious’ lies doubtless the
physical <ab>mg</ab> ‘settle forward, incline towards, <lbinfo n="to-wards,"/>
 {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} a suppliant.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} sink, {%used%} ({%like the <ab>Eng.</ab>%} be depressed)  <lbinfo n="de-pressed)"/>
of the spirits, be dejected; despond, <lbinfo n="de-spond,"/>
 <ls n="lan,35,11">35<sup>11</sup></ls>; come to grief, <ls n="lan,31,1">31<sup>1</sup></ls>; {@विषण्ण,@}
dejected.
<div n="p"/>{@+ सम्,@} sit together.

<L>4398<pc>266-a<k1>सन<k2>स/न
{@स्áन,@}¦ {%<ab>a.</ab>%} old. [<ab>orig.</ab> ‘of long standing,
long continued’: <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἕνο-ς</lang>, ‘old’; <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%sen-ex,%} ‘old man’; <ab>Goth.</ab> {%sin-ista,%} ‘oldest’;
<ab>AS.</ab> {%sin-ceald,%} ‘perpetually {%or%} extremely
cold’; <ab>AS.</ab> and Old <ab>Eng.</ab> {%sin-grēne,%} ‘evergreen, <lbinfo n="‘ever-green,"/>
’ <ab>Eng.</ab> {%sen-green,%} ‘(extremely green,
{%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) house-leek’: from a not quotable
<ab>Goth.</ab> {%*sina-skalks,%} Medieval <ab>Lat.</ab> {%siniscalcus,%} <lbinfo n="sini-scalcus,"/>
‘oldest house-servant,’ through
intermediate Romance forms, comes <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%seneschal;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Sünd-flut,%} ‘sin-flood,’ is a
popular interpretation of Old High <ab>Ger.</ab>
{%sin-vluot,%} ‘the long-continued flood, the
Noachian deluge.’]

‘put,’ {@+ सम्,@} <ls n="wg,1155">1155.</ls> 2e.]

<L>4523<pc>270-a<k1>सह्<k2>सह्
{@√sah@}¦ ({@sáhate; sasā́ha, sasahé; ásahiṣṭa;@}
{@sahiṣyáte; soḍhá@} [<ls n="wg,222">222<sup>3</sup></ls>]; {@sáhitum, sóḍhum;@} <lbinfo n="só-ḍhum;"/>
{@-sáhya@}). <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} overpower, <ls n="lan,99,8">99<sup>8</sup></ls>;
be victorious, <ls n="lan,78,4">78<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} hold out against,
withstand; {%and so%} bear; endure patiently,
<ls n="lan,32,7">32<sup>7</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>orig.</ab> ‘be powerful, withstand, hold
back, hold’: <ab>cf.</ab> the collateral {@√सघ्,@}
‘take on one's self, bear’: <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἴσχω, *σι</lang>-
<lang n="greek">σχ-ω</lang>, ‘hold back’; <lang n="greek">ἔχω, ἔ-σχ-ον</lang>, ‘hold {%or%}
[Page270-b+ 50]
have, had’: --<ab>w.</ab> {@सहस्, *सघ्-अस्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> the
Germanic stem {%seg-oz,%} as it appears in
<ab>Goth.</ab> <ab>neut.</ab> {%sigis,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%sigor,%} <ab>prob.</ab> neuter,
all meaning ‘victory’; the stem appears
also in {%Seges-tes,%} name of a Cheruscan
prince (Tacitus, Annals), and in {%Sigismund:%} <lbinfo n="Sigis-mund:%"/>
<ab>cf.</ab> also <ab>AS.</ab> {%sige,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%Sieg,%}
‘victory.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} hold out, endure; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} be
able, {%<ab>w.</ab> <ab>inf.</ab>;%} {@कथं स्वार्थम् उत्सहे,@}
how can I ({%<ab>sc.</ab>%} do, prosecute) my own
object.

<L>4679<pc>275-a<k1>सू<k2>सू
{@√sū@}¦ {%or%} {@su@} ({@sū́te@} [<ls n="wg,628">628]</ls>; {@suṣā́va, suṣuvé;@}
{@ásoṣṭa; saviṣyáti, -te; soṣyáti, -te;@}
{@sūtá, sutá; sūtvā́; -sū́ya@}). generate;
bring forth; bear; {%so perhaps at%} <ab>RV.</ab> x.
<ls n="wg,125">125.</ls> 7. [<ab>cf.</ab> {@२सुत,@} ‘bairn’; <lang n="greek">υἱὀς, *συ-ιο-ς</lang>,
‘son’; for pronunciation as trisyllable,
<lang n="greek">ὑ-ι-ός</lang>, <ab>cf.</ab> Boeotian <lang n="greek">οὑιός</lang>: see also under
{@sū́@} and {@sūnú.@}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्र,@} bring forth; {@प्रसूत,@} born of
({%<ab>gen.</ab>%}).

[Page275-b+ 50]
<L>4680<pc>275-b<k1>सू<k2>सू/
{@sū́@}¦ [<ls n="wg,351">351]</ls>, {%<ab>vbl.</ab>%} bearing, {%in%} {@vīrasū;@} {%as <ab>f.</ab>%}
mother. [{@√सू,@} <ab>q. v.</ab>: with {@सू́-स्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">σῦ-ς</lang>,
<lang n="greek">ὗ-ς</lang>, <ab>Lat.</ab> {%sū-s,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%sū,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%sow%} (qua pecude
nihil genuit natura fecundius--Cicero,
<ab>cf.</ab> {%verres%} under {@√vṛṣ@}); also <ab>AS.</ab> {%swīn,%}
{%*su-īna,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%swine,%} <ab>prop.</ab> a diminutive of
{%sū.%}]

<L>4699<pc>276-a<k1>सृ<k2>सृ

{@sṛtá; sártum; sṛtvā́; -sṛ́tya;@}
{@sāráyati, -te@}). run swiftly, glide, flow;
{%<ab>caus.</ab> <ab>act.</ab>%} set in motion. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ὁρ-μή</lang>, ‘rush,

‘pool,’ {@सरित्,@} ‘stream,’ and, for the root
with 1, {@सल्-इल,@} ‘flowing’ and ‘fluid, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
water.’]

<div n="p"/>{@+ निस्,@} go out; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} drive out {%or%} away.

<ls n="lan,30,3">30<sup>3</sup></ls>; {@व्यापादितस् तिष्ठति,@} lies dead, <ls n="lan,44,16">44<sup>16</sup></ls>;

be situated, be, <ls n="lan,1,5">1<sup>5</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,26,13">26<sup>13</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,33,4">33<sup>4</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—7.@} (remain
standing, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} unmoved {%or%} untouched, {%and%}
{%so, like <ab>Ger.</ab>%} dahingestellt bleiben) remain
unconsidered {%or%} unmentioned; {%thus,%} {@dūre@}
{@तिष्ठतु तद्वृद्धिस्,@} (let the interest of
it stand afar off, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) to say nothing of
the interest of it, <ls n="lan,46,20">46<sup>20</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—८। स्थित्á,@} {%see <ab>s. v.</ab>;%}
<div n="2"/>{@—9.@} {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} cause to stand, set; put, <ls n="lan,41,19">41<sup>19</sup></ls>.
<div n="1"/>[for {@*stā:@} <ab>cf.</ab> Doric <ab>inf.</ab> <lang n="greek">στᾶ-μεν</lang>, Epic
<lang n="greek">στῆ-ναι</lang>, Church Slavonic {%sta-ti,%} <ab>Lat.</ab> {%stā-re,%}
Old High <ab>Ger.</ab> {%stā-n,%} <ab>Ger.</ab> {%steh-en,%} ‘stand’:
this old form of the root appears also in
<ab>Ger.</ab> {%Statt,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%stede,%} <ab>Eng.</ab> {%stead,%} ‘place’:
the prevailing form of the root in Germanic  <lbinfo n="Ger-manic"/>
is {%stand;%} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>AS.</ab> {%stond-an,%} <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%stand;%} <ab>Ger.</ab> preterit {%stand,%} ‘stood’: --with
{@á-स्था-त्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἔ-στη</lang>, ‘stood’; <ab>w.</ab> {@त्í-ष्ठा-मि,@}
<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἵ-στη-μι</lang>, ‘set,’ <ab>Lat.</ab> {%si-sti-t,%} ‘sets’:--for
<ab>mgs</ab> of {@√स्था,@} <ab>cf.</ab> in general those of
<ab>Eng.</ab> {%stand.%}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अधि,@} stand upon.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अनु,@} --1. (stand along by, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) take
one's place along by, {%and so%} support,
help; --2. devote one's self to a thing,
{%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} virtue, <ls n="lan,58,16">58<sup>16</sup></ls>; devote one's self to (an
undertaking), {%and so%} carry out (a plan),
<ls n="lan,33,14">33<sup>14</sup></ls>; accomplish; {%<ab>pass.</ab> <ab>impers.</ab>:%} {@evam@}
{@अनुष्ठेयम्,@} it must be done so, <ls n="lan,37,8">37<sup>8</sup></ls>;
{%so%} <ls n="lan,38,15">38<sup>15</sup></ls>; {@तथा_अनुष्ठिते,@} it having been
thus accomplished, this being done, <ls n="lan,33,14">33<sup>14</sup></ls>;
{%see%} <ls n="wg,303">303b<sup>4</sup></ls> {%and <ab>cf.</ab>%} <ls n="lan,35,16">35<sup>16</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,37,13">37<sup>13</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,39,15, 22">39<sup>15, 22</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अभि,@} set the foot upon, vanquish;
withstand.
<div n="p"/>{@+ अव,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} stand off, <ls n="lan,105,20">105<sup>20</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@}

dwelling; {%--<ab>caus.</ab>%} (cause to stand apart,

<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} take one's place at; resort to, <ls n="lan,10,1">10<sup>1</sup></ls>.

of respect).

{@smitá; smitvā́; -smítya@}). smile; smile
bashfully; blush. [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">φιλο-μμειδής</lang>, ‘fond
of smiles,’ stem <lang n="greek">σμειδες</lang>, as in Hesychian
<lang n="greek">μεῖδος</lang>, ‘smile’; <lang n="greek">μειδάω</lang>, ‘smile’; <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%mī-ru-s,%} ‘wonderful,’ {%mīrāri,%} ‘wonder’ (for
<ab>mg</ab>, <ab>cf.</ab> {@स्मय,@} ‘wonder’); Middle High
<ab>Ger.</ab> {%smie-r-en, smie-l-en,%} ‘smile’; <ab>Eng.</ab>
{%smile, smirk.%}]
<div n="p"/>{@+ वि,@} be astonished.
<LEND>

<L>4785<pc>281-a<k1>स्मृ<k2>स्मृ

<div n="2"/>{@—1.@} remember, {%both%} keep in mind {%and%}
call to mind; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} call to mind, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} hand

handed down by {@smṛti@} {%or%} taught by
tradition; {%and so%} <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} declared to be…,
<ls n="lan,61,2">61<sup>2</sup></ls>; passing for…; regarded by tradition  <lbinfo n="tra-dition"/>
as…, <ls n="lan,63,6">63<sup>6</sup></ls>; {%to be variously paraphrased;%} <lbinfo n="para-phrased;"/>

are taught, the path, <ls n="lan,21,7">21<sup>7</sup></ls>; called, <ls n="lan,22,5">22<sup>5</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,57,6">57<sup>6</sup></ls>.

<L>4859<pc>284-b<k1>हत्य<k2>हत्य
{@हत्य,@}¦ {%<ab>n.</ab>%} slaying [{@√हन्,@} <ls n="wg,1213">1213c</ls> and a
(middle), <ab>cf.</ab> <ls n="wg,954">954d</ls>.]
<LEND>
<L>4860<pc>284-b<k1>हन्<k2>हन्
{@√han@}¦ ({@hánti@} [<ls n="wg,637">637]</ls>; {@jaghā́na@} [<ls n="wg,794">794d</ls>];
{@haniṣyáti; hatá@} [<ls n="wg,954">954d</ls>]; {@hántum; hatvā́;@}
{@-hátya; hanyáte; jíghāṃsati@} [<ls n="wg,1028">1028f</ls>]).
<div n="2"/>{@—1.@} strike; strike down; smite {%or%} slay,
<ls n="lan,70,2">70<sup>2</sup></ls>, <ab>etc.</ab>; kill, <ls n="lan,28,6">28<sup>6</sup></ls>, <ls n="lan,35,14">35<sup>14</sup></ls>, <ab>etc.</ab>; overcome;
<div n="2"/>{@—2.@} destroy, <ls n="lan,37,19">37<sup>19</sup></ls>; bring to nought; (of
darkness) dispel, <ls n="lan,18,3">18<sup>3</sup></ls>; {%--<ab>desid.</ab>%} wish to
smite {%or%} afflict, <ls n="lan,78,16">78<sup>16</sup></ls>;
<div n="1"/>{@--हत्á,@} <div n="2"/>{@—1.@} smitten, slain, <ls n="lan,98,4">98<sup>4</sup></ls>; killed,
<ls n="lan,23,21">23<sup>21</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—2.@} destroyed, ruined; lost, <ls n="lan,27,13">27<sup>13</sup></ls>,
<ls n="lan,42,1">42<sup>1</sup></ls>; <div n="2"/>{@—3.@} pounded.
<div n="1"/>[with {@ह्áन्-मि,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">θείνω, *θεν-ϳω,</lang>, ‘smite’;
<ab>w.</ab> {@ज-घ्न्-úस्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">ἔ-πε-φν-ον</lang>, ‘slew’; <ab>w.</ab>
{@हत्á, *घत,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">φατός</lang>, ‘slain’; <ab>w.</ab> {@घन्á,@}
<ab>q. v.</ab>, ‘a slaying,’ <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">φόνος</lang>, ‘slaughter’; <ab>w.</ab>
{@ह-ति,@} ‘a smiting, slaying,’ <ab>cf.</ab> Old High
<ab>Ger.</ab> {%gun-d,%} <ab>AS.</ab> {%gūð, *gun-ð,%} ‘battle’; <ab>AS.</ab>
{%gūð-fana,%} Old High <ab>Ger.</ab> {%gund-fano,%} ‘battleflag’; <lbinfo n="‘battle-flag’;"/>
 <ab>fr.</ab> the last form (not <ab>fr.</ab> the <ab>AS.</ab>),
through the French, comes <ab>Eng.</ab> {%gonfanon,%}
{%gonfalon;%} for <ab>mg</ab> of {%gūð,%} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Ger.</ab> {%schlagen,%}
‘smite, slay,’ with {%Schlacht,%} ‘battle’: for
senses under 1, observe that <ab>AS.</ab> {%sleān%}
(whence <ab>Eng.</ab> {%slay%}) means ‘smite’ and
then also ‘slay.’]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अव,@} strike down; bring to nought.
<div n="p"/>{@+ आ,@} strike upon; hurl (a bolt) upon ({%<ab>loc.</ab>%}
[Page285-a+ 50]
{%<ab>w.</ab>%} {@adhi@}); {%<ab>mid.</ab>%} strike (one's thigh with
one's hand).
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} force up; {@uddhata@} [<ls n="wg,163">163]</ls>, raised.
<div n="p"/>{@+ नि,@} strike down; slay.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} strike around; encompass.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्रति,@} strike back at ({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}); strike
against so as to transfix, to broach (on a
lance, {%<ab>loc.</ab>%}).

<L>4911<pc>286-b<k1>हु<k2>हु
{@√hu@}¦ ({@juhóti, juhuté; juhā́va, juhvé;@}
{@áhauṣīt; hoṣyáti; hutá; hótum; hutvā́@}).
pour into the fire, cast into the fire; {%and%}
{%so%} offer; make oblation even of things
not cast into the fire; {@hutá;@} offered; {%as%}
{%<ab>n.</ab>%} oblation.
<div n="1"/>[<ab>orig.</ab> {@*ghu:@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">χέω, *χεϝ-ω</lang>, ‘pour’;
<lang n="greek">χυ-λό-ς</lang>, ‘liquid, juice’; <ab>w.</ab> {@हु-त्á,@} <ab>cf.</ab>
<lang n="greek">χυ-τό-ς</lang>, ‘poured’; <ab>w.</ab> {@आ-हु-ति,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">χύ-σι-ς</lang>,
‘a pouring,’ <ab>Lat.</ab> {%fū-ti-s,%} ‘water-pot’;
further, {%fons,%} stem {%font, *fov-ont,%} ‘pouring, <lbinfo n="‘pour-ing,"/>
’ {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} ‘fountain’:
<div n="1"/>with the extended form {@*घुद्,@} <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Lat.</ab>
{%√fud%} in {%fund-ere,%} ‘pour,’ <ab>AS.</ab> {%geōt-an,%} <ab>Ger.</ab>
{%giessen,%} ‘pour’; provincial <ab>Eng.</ab> {%gut,%}
‘water-course’; and <ab>Eng.</ab> {%gut,%} <ab>w.</ab> like
sense, in {%Gut of Canso.%}]

in the fire (of a corpse), <ls n="lan,84,12">84<sup>12</sup></ls>; {%as <ab>n.</ab>%} oblation. <lbinfo n="obla-tion."/>

<L>4917<pc>287-a<k1>हृ<k2>हृ<h>1
{@√१हृ@}¦ ({@ह्áरति, -ते; जहा́र, जह्र्é; áहार्षीत्,@}
{@áhṛṣṭa; hariṣyáti, -te; hṛtá; hártum;@}

({%like <ab>Eng.</ab>%} take) charm, captivate; <div n="2"/>{@—8.@}
(carry off, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} remove, {%and so%}) destroy.
[<ab>cf.</ab> <lang n="greek">χείρ</lang>, dialectic <lang n="greek">χέρ-ς</lang>, ‘hand’; <lang n="greek">εὐ-χερ</lang>-
<lang n="greek">ής</lang>, ‘easy to handle’; <ab>Lat.</ab> {%hir,%} ‘hand’;
{%hērēs,%} ‘heir,’ see root, <ab>mg</ab> 5.]
<div n="p"/>{@+ अव,@} (carry down, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}) move down.
<div n="p"/>{@+ व्य्-अव,@} move hither and thither, go
to work, proceed, <ab>act.</ab>

get back, <ls n="lan,97,10">97<sup>10</sup></ls>.
<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्-आ,@} bring out, {%and so%} utter, say, tell.
<div n="p"/>{@+ प्रत्य्-आ,@} get back again; {%at%} <ls n="lan,11,6">11<sup>6</sup></ls>, {%incorrect %} <lbinfo n="in-correct"/>
{%reading for%} {@pra-vy-ā-.@}
<div n="p"/>{@+ व्य्-आ,@} bring out, {%and so%} utter;

{%with%} {@वाचम्,@} speak words to a person  <lbinfo n="per-son"/>
({%<ab>acc.</ab>%}), <ls n="lan,3,1">3<sup>1</sup></ls>; {%similarly,%} <ls n="lan,8,19">8<sup>19</sup></ls>.

<div n="p"/>{@+ उद्,@} take out.
<div n="p"/>{@+ परि,@} carry around.

out, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} feet, fists, {%and so%}) strike, attack,
